verses.text: Whence is this manifest? Because as he shows from his own temptations and their testimony, and the way in which he acted, that he did not preach with flattery or vainglory; so from their trials, he shows also that they rightly received the word.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:55
verses.text: For whence, he says, unless ye had heard as if God were speaking, did ye endure such perils? And observe his dignity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:56
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:58
verses.text: "For ye, brethren, became imitators of the Churches of God, which are in Judaea in Christ Jesus: for ye also suffered the same things of your own countrymen, even as they did of the Jews; who both killed the Lord Jesus and their own prophets, and drave out us, and please not God, and are contrary to all men; forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles that they may be saved; to fill up their sins alway: but the wrath is come upon them to the uttermost".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:59
verses.text: "For ye," he says, "became imitators of the Churches of God which are in Judaea".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:60
verses.text: This is a great consolation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:61
verses.text: It is no wonder, he says, that they should do these things to you, inasmuch as they have done it also to their own countrymen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:62
verses.text: And this too is no little proof that the Preaching is true, that even Jews were able to endure all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:63
verses.text: "For ye also," he says, "have suffered the same things of your own countrymen, even as they did of the Jews".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:64
verses.text: There is something more in his saying, "as they also did in Judaea"; it shows that everywhere they rejoiced, as having nobly contended.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:65
verses.text: He says therefore, "that ye also suffered the same things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:66
verses.text: And again, what wonder is it, if to you also, when even to the Lord they dared do such things?  Do you see how he introduces this as containing great consolation? And constantly he adverts to it; and upon a close examination one may find it in nearly all his Epistles, how variously, upon all occasions of temptation, he brings forward Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:67
verses.text: Observe accordingly, that here also, when accusing the Jews, he puts them in mind of the Lord, and of the sufferings of the Lord; so well does he know that this is a matter of the greatest consolation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:68
verses.text: "Who both killed the Lord," he says—but, perhaps, they did not know Him,—assuredly they did know Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:69
verses.text: What then? Did they not slay and stone their own prophets, whose books even they carry about with them? And they did not do this for the sake of truth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:70
verses.text: There is therefore not only a consolation under the temptations, but they are reminded not to think that (the Jews) did it for the truth's sake, and be troubled on that account.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:71
verses.text: "And drave out us," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:72
verses.text: And we also, he says, have suffered numberless evils.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:73
verses.text: "And please not God, and are contrary to all men; forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles, that they may be saved".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:74
verses.text: "Contrary to all men," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:75
verses.text: How? Because if we ought to speak to the world, and they forbid us, they are the common enemies of the world.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:76
verses.text: They have slain Christ and the prophets, they insult God, they are the common enemies of the world, they banish us, when coming for their salvation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:77
verses.text: What wonder if they have done such things also to you, when they have done them even in Judaea? "Forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles, that they might be saved".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:78
verses.text: It is a mark of envy therefore to hinder the salvation of all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:79
verses.text: "To fill up their sins alway.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:80
verses.text: But the wrath is come upon them to the uttermost".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:81
verses.text: What is "to the uttermost"? These things are no longer like the former.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:82
verses.text: There is here no return back, no limit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:83
verses.text: But the wrath is nigh at hand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:84
verses.text: Whence is this manifest? From that which Christ foretold.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:85
verses.text: For not only is it a consolation to have partakers in our afflictions, but to hear also that our persecutors are to be punished.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:86
verses.text: And if the delay is a grievance, let it be a consolation that they will never lift up their heads again; or rather he hath cut short the delay, by saying, "THE wrath," showing that it was long ago due, and predetermined, and predicted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:87
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:88
verses.text: "But we, being taken from you for a short time in presence, not in heart, endeavored the more abundantly to see your face with great desire".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:89
verses.text: He has not said "separated," but what was much more.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:90
verses.text: He had spoken above of flattery, showing that he did not flatter, that he did not seek glory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:91
verses.text: He speaks here concerning love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:92
verses.text: Because he had said above, "as a father his children," "as a nurse," here he uses another expression, "being made orphans," which is said of children who have lost their fathers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:93
verses.text: And yet they were made orphans.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:94
verses.text: "No"—he says—"but we.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:95
verses.text: For if any one should examine our longing, even as little children without a protector, having sustained an untimely bereavement, long for their parents, not only from the feelings of nature itself, but also on account of their deserted state, so truly do we too feel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:96
verses.text: From this also he shows his own despondency on account of their separation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:97
verses.text: And this we cannot say, he says, that we have waited a long period, but "for a short time," and that "in presence, not in heart".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:98
verses.text: For we always have you in our mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:99
verses.text: See how great is his love! Although having them always in his heart, he sought also their presence face to face.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:100
verses.text: Tell me not of your superlative philosophy! This is truly fervent love; both to see, and to hear, and speak; and this may be of much advantage.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:101
verses.text: "We endeavored the more exceedingly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:102
verses.text: What is "more exceedingly"? He either means to say, "we are vehemently attached to you," or, "as was likely, being bereaved for a season, we endeavored to see your face".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:103
verses.text: Observe the blessed Paul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:104
verses.text: When of himself he cannot satisfy his longing, he does it through others, as when he sends Timothy to the Philippians, and the same person again to the Corinthians, holding intercourse with them through others, when he cannot of himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:105
verses.text: For in loving them, he was like some mad person, not to be restrained, nor to command himself in his affection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:106
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:107
verses.text: "Wherefore we would fain have come unto you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:108
verses.text: Which is the part of love; yet here he mentions no other necessity but "that we might see you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:109
verses.text: "I Paul once and again, and Satan hindered us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:110
verses.text: What sayest thou? does Satan hinder? Yes, truly, for this was not the work of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:111
verses.text: For in the Epistle to the Romans, he says this, that God hindered him (from Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:112
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:113
verses.text: ); and elsewhere Luke says, that "the Spirit" hindered them from going into Asia.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:114
verses.text: (Acts xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:115
verses.text: ) And in the Epistle to the Corinthians he says, that it is the work of the Spirit, but here only of Satan.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:116
verses.text: But what hindrance of Satan is he speaking of? Some unexpected and violent temptations: for a plot, it says, being formed against him by the Jews, he was detained three months in Greece.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:117
verses.text: But it is another thing to remain for the sake of the dispensation, and willingly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:118
verses.text: For there he says, "Wherefore having no more place in these parts" (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:119
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:120
verses.text: ), and, "To spare you I forbare to come unto Corinth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:121
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:122
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:123
verses.text: ) But here nothing of this sort.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:124
verses.text: But what? That "Satan hindered" him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:125
verses.text: "Even I Paul," he says, "both once and again".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:126
verses.text: Observe, how ambitious he is, and what a display he makes, in his willingness to show that he loved them most of all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:127
verses.text: "I Paul," he says, instead of Although no others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:128
verses.text: For they indeed were only willing, but I even attempted it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:129
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:130
verses.text: "For what is our hope, or joy, or crown of glorying? Are not even ye before our Lord Jesus at His coming?"  Are the Macedonians, tell me, thy hope, O blessed Paul? Not these alone, he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:131
verses.text: Therefore he has added, "Are not ye also?" For "what," he says, "is our hope, or joy, or crown of glorying"? Observe then the words, which are those of women, inflamed with tenderness, talking to their little children.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:132
verses.text: "And crown of glorying," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:133
verses.text: For the name of "crown" was not sufficient to express the splendor, but also "of glorying".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:134
verses.text: Of what fiery warmth is this! Never could either mother, or father, yea if they even met together, and commingled their love, have shown their own affection to be equivalent to that of Paul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:135
verses.text: "My joy and crown," he says, that is, I rejoice in you more than in a crown.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:136
verses.text: For consider how great a thing it is, that an entire Church should be present, planted and rooted by Paul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:137
verses.text: Who would not rejoice in such a multitude of children, and in the goodness of those children? So that this also is not flattery.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:138
verses.text: For he has not said "ye," but "ye also" together with the others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:139
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:140
verses.text: "For ye are our glory and our joy".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:141
verses.text: Chap.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:142
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:144
verses.text: "Wherefore, when we could no longer forbear, we thought it good to be left behind at Athens alone".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:145
verses.text: Instead of saying, "we chose".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:146
verses.text: "And sent Timothy, our brother and God's minister and our fellow-worker in the Gospel of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:147
verses.text: And this he says, not as extolling Timothy, but honoring them, that he sent them the fellow-worker, and minister of the Gospel.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:148
verses.text: As if he had said, Having withdrawn him from his labors we have sent to you the minister of God, and our fellow-laborer in the Gospel of Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:149
verses.text: "To establish you, and to comfort you concerning your faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:150
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:151
verses.text: "That no man be moved by these afflictions".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:152
verses.text: What then does he say here? Because the temptations of the teachers trouble their disciples, and he had then fallen into many temptations, as also he himself says, that "Satan hindered us," always saying this; "both once," he says, "and again I would have come to you," and was not able, which was a proof of great violence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:153
verses.text: And it was reasonable that this should trouble them, for they are not so much troubled at their own temptations, as at those of their teachers; as neither is the soldier so much troubled at his own trials, as when he sees his general wounded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:154
verses.text: "To establish you," he says; not that they were at all deficient in faith, nor that they required to learn anything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:155
verses.text: "And to comfort you concerning your faith; that no man be moved by these afflictions; for yourselves know that hereunto we are appointed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:156
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:157
verses.text: "For verily, when we were with you, we told you beforehand that we are to suffer affliction; even as it came to pass, and ye know".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:158
verses.text: Ye ought not, he says, to be troubled, for nothing strange, nothing contrary to expectation is happening; which was sufficient to raise them up.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:159
verses.text: For do you see that on this account also Christ foretold to His disciples? For hear Him saying, "Now I have told you before it came to pass, that when it is come to pass ye may believe".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:160
verses.text: (John xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:161
verses.text: ) For greatly indeed, greatly does it tend to the comfort of others, to have heard from their teachers what is to happen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:162
verses.text: For as he that is sick, if he hear from his physician that this or that is taking place, is not much troubled; but if anything happen unexpectedly, as if he too were at a loss, and the disorder was beyond his art, he is afflicted and troubled; so also is it here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:163
verses.text: Which Paul foreknowing, foretold to them, "we are about to be afflicted," "as it came to pass, and ye know".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:164
verses.text: He not only says that this came to pass, but that he foretold many things, and they happened.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:165
verses.text: "Hereunto we are appointed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:166
verses.text: So that not only ye ought not to be troubled and disturbed about the past, but not even about the future, if any such thing should happen, "for hereunto we are appointed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:167
verses.text: Moral.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:168
verses.text: Let us hear, who have ears to hear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:169
verses.text: The Christian is appointed hereunto.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:170
verses.text: For concerning all the faithful is this said, "Hereunto we are appointed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:171
verses.text: And we, as if we were appointed for ease, think it strange if we suffer anything; and yet what reason have we for thinking anything strange? For no season of affliction or temptation has overtaken us, but what is common to man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:172
verses.text: It is a fit season for us to say to you, "Ye have not yet resisted unto blood, striving against sin" (Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:173
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:175
verses.text: Or rather, this is not seasonable for us to say to you—but what? Ye have not yet despised riches.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:176
verses.text: For to them indeed these words were said with reason, when they had lost all their own possessions, but this is said to those who retain theirs.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:177
verses.text: Who has been robbed of his riches for Christ's sake? Who has been beaten? Who has been insulted? even in words, I mean.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:178
verses.text: What have you to boast of? What confidence have you to say anything? So many things Christ suffered for us when we were enemies.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:179
verses.text: What can we show that we have suffered for Him? Nothing that we have suffered indeed, but infinite good things that we have received from Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:180
verses.text: Whence shall we have confidence in that Day? Know ye not, that the soldier too, when he can show numberless wounds and scars, will then be able to shine in the presence of the king? But if he has no good action to show, though he may have done no harm, he will take rank among the least.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:181
verses.text: But, you say, it is not the season of war.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:182
verses.text: But if it was, tell me, who would contend? Who would attack? Who would break through the phalanx? Perhaps no one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:183
verses.text: For when I see that you do not despise riches for the sake of Christ, how shall I believe that you will despise blows? Tell me, do you bear manfully those who insult you, and do you bless them? You do not—but you disobey.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:184
verses.text: What is attended with no danger, you do not; and will you endure blows, in which there is much pain and suffering? Know ye not that it is proper in peace to keep up the exercises of war? Do you not see these soldiers, who though no war disturbs them, but it is profound peace, brightening up their arms, and going forth with the teachers who teach them tactics, into the broad and level plains, I may say, every day, keep up with the greatest strictness the exercises of war? Of our spiritual soldiers, who has done this? No one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:185
verses.text: For this reason we become in war weak and ignoble, and easily led captive by any.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:186
verses.text: But what stupidity is this, not to think the present a season of war, when Paul is crying out, "Yea, and all that would live godly in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution" ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:187
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:188
verses.text: ); and Christ says, "In the world ye shall have tribulation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:189
verses.text: (John xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:190
verses.text: ) And again the blessed Paul with a loud voice cries out, saying, "Our wrestling is not against flesh and blood," and again, "Stand therefore, having girded your loins with truth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:191
verses.text: (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:192
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:193
verses.text: and.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:194
verses.text: ) Why dost thou arm us, tell me, when it is not war? Why dost thou give us trouble to no purpose? Thou puttest breastplates on the soldiers, when it is allowed them to rest and revive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:195
verses.text: But he would have said, Certainly, however, though it were not war, it would be right to attend to the concerns of war.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:196
verses.text: For he who in peace considers the business of battle, will be formidable in the season of battle; but he who is without experience in the things of war, will be more troubled even in peace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:197
verses.text: Why so? Because he will weep for the things which he possesses, and not being able to fight for them, will be in anguish.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:198
verses.text: For the possessions of the cowardly and inexperienced and ignoble in war, are the property of all who are brave and warlike.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:199
verses.text: So that on this account first I arm you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:200
verses.text: But then also the whole time of our life is the season of war.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:201
verses.text: How and in what respect? The devil is ever at hand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:202
verses.text: Hear what it says, "As a roaring lion, he walketh about, seeking whom he may devour".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:203
verses.text: ( Pet.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:204
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:205
verses.text: ) Numberless bodily affections assail us, which it is necessary to enumerate, that we may not vainly deceive ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:206
verses.text: For tell me, what does not war against us? Riches, beauty, pleasure, power, authority, envy, glory, pride? For not only does our own glory war against us, forbidding us to descend to humility; but the glory of others also, leading us to envy and ill-nature.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:207
verses.text: But what do their opposites, poverty, dishonor, the being despised, rejected, the having no power? These things indeed are in us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:208
verses.text: But from men proceed wickedness, plots, deceits, slanders, assaults innumerable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:209
verses.text: In like manner on the part of the demons, "principalities, powers, the world-rulers of this darkness, spiritual hosts of wickedness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:210
verses.text: Some of us are rejoicing, others grieving, both are deviations from the right course.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:211
verses.text: But health and sickness (war against us).

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:212
verses.text: From what quarter will not man be falling into sin? Would you that I should tell you from the beginning, commencing even immediately from Adam? What took captive the first created? Pleasure, and eating, and the love of dominion.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:213
verses.text: What the son who came next after him? Grudging and envy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:214
verses.text: What those in the time of Noah? Fleshly pleasures, and the evils issuing from them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:215
verses.text: What his son? Insolence and irreverence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:216
verses.text: What the Sodomites? Insolence, wantonness; and fullness of bread.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:217
verses.text: But often even poverty has this effect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:218
verses.text: On this account a certain wise man said, "Give me neither poverty nor riches".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:219
verses.text: (Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:220
verses.text: xxx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:221
verses.text: ) However it is neither poverty nor riches, but the will that cannot use either of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:222
verses.text: "Acknowledge," he says, "that thou passest through the midst of snares".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:223
verses.text: (Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:224
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:225
verses.text: )  The blessed Paul has admirably said, "Hereunto we are appointed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:226
verses.text: He has not said merely, that we are tempted, but that "hereunto we are appointed," as if he had said, For this were we born.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:227
verses.text: This is our business, this our life, and dost thou seek rest? The executioner does not stand over us, lacerating our sides, and compelling us to sacrifice; but the desire of riches, and of possessing more, is instant, tearing out our eyes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:228
verses.text: No soldier has kindled a pile, nor placed us on a gridiron, but more than this, the flames of the flesh set fire on our souls.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:229
verses.text: No king is present promising numberless bounties, and putting us out of countenance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:230
verses.text: But there is present a rage for glory, tickling us worse than he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:231
verses.text: A great war, truly, exceedingly great, if we would watch.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:232
verses.text: And the present season too has its crowns.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:233
verses.text: Hear Paul saying, "Henceforth there is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the righteous Judge shall give me…and not only to me, but also to all them that have loved His appearing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:234
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:235
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:236
verses.text: ) When thou hast lost a beloved and only son, whom thou wert bringing up in much wealth, displaying good hopes, himself being the only one to succeed to thine inheritance; do not complain, but give thanks to God, and glorify Him who has taken him, and in this respect thou wilt not be worse than Abraham.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:237
verses.text: For as he gave him to God, when he commanded it, so thou hast not complained, when He has taken him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:238
verses.text: Hast thou fallen into a severe sickness, and do many come, constraining thee, some with charms, some with amulets, and others with other things, to remedy the evil? and hast thou borne it firmly and unflinchingly from the fear of God, and wouldst thou have chosen to suffer all things rather than submit to do any of those idolatrous practices? This brings to thee the crown of martyrdom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:239
verses.text: Doubt it not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:240
verses.text: And how and by what means, I will tell thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:241
verses.text: For as such an one bears firmly the pains of torture, so as not to worship the image, so thou also bearest the sufferings of thy disease, so as to want nothing of those remedies which the other offers, nor to do the things which he prescribes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:242
verses.text: "But those pains are more violent"—yes, but these are of longer duration, so that it is the same in the end; nay often these are more violent too.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:243
verses.text: For tell me, when fever is raging and burning within, and thou rejectest the charm that others recommend to thee, hast thou not bound on thee the crown of martyrdom?  Again, has any one lost money? many advise thee to have recourse to diviners; but thou, from fear of God, because it is forbidden, choosest rather not to receive thy money than to disobey God—thou hast a reward equal to him who has given it to the poor, if having lost, thou givest thanks, and when able to have recourse to diviners, thou bearest not to receive, rather than so to receive it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:244
verses.text: For as he from the fear of God has given all to the needy, so thou also from fear of God, when they have plundered thee, hast not recovered it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:245
verses.text: We are the masters of injuring or not injuring ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:246
verses.text: And if you will, let us make the whole matter plain in the case of theft itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:247
verses.text: The thief has cut through the wall, he has rushed into the chamber, he has carried off costly golden vessels, and precious stones, in short, he has cleared thy whole treasure, and has not been taken.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:248
verses.text: The fact is grievous, and it seems to be a loss; still as yet it is not so but it depends on thee to make it either a loss or a gain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:249
verses.text: And how, sayest thou, can this be a gain? I will endeavor to show thee how, if thou art willing, it will be a great gain, but if unwilling, the loss will be severer than that which has taken place.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:250
verses.text: For as in the case of artificers, when material is before them, he who is skilled in his art uses it to good purpose, but he that is unskillful spoils it, and makes it a loss to him, so also in these matters.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:251
verses.text: How then will it be a gain? If thou givest thanks to God, if thou dost not wail bitterly, if thou utterest the words of Job, "The Lord gave and the Lord hath taken away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:252
verses.text: Naked came I out of my mother's womb, naked shall I also go away".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:253
verses.text: (Job i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:254
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:255
verses.text: )  "What?" sayest thou, "the Lord hath taken away? The thief hath taken away, and how canst thou say, the Lord hath taken away?" Wonder not, for even Job, of things which the devil took away, said, These the Lord hath taken away? And shalt not thou say of what the thief took, The Lord hath taken away? Tell me, whom dost thou admire? him who has bestowed all his goods upon the poor, or Job for these words? Is he, who did not then give, inferior to him, who has given alms? For say not, "I feel no thankfulness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:256
verses.text: The matter was not done with my consent, or knowledge, or will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:257
verses.text: The robber took it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:258
verses.text: What will be my reward?" Neither did these things happen with Job's knowledge or will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:259
verses.text: For how could it be? Nevertheless, he wrestled.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:260
verses.text: And it is in thy power to receive as great a reward, as if thou hadst cast it away willingly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:261
verses.text: And perhaps we admire this man more, who thankfully suffers wrongs, than him who gives spontaneously.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:262
verses.text: And why? Because the latter indeed is fed with praises, and supported by conscience, and has good hopes; and having before borne manfully the privation of his goods, he then cast them away; but the former, whilst yet bound to them, was forcibly deprived of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:263
verses.text: And it is not the same thing, having first been induced to part with riches, in that way to bestow them, as it is while yet longing to be deprived of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:264
verses.text: If thou wilt say these words, thou wilt receive many times as much, and even more than Job.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:265
verses.text: For he received twice as much here, but to thee Christ has promised a hundred fold.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:266
verses.text: From the fear of God, thou hast not blasphemed? thou hast not had recourse to diviners? suffering wrong, thou hast been thankful? Thou art like one who despises wealth, for thou couldest not do this, hadst thou not first despised it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:267
verses.text: And it is not the same thing in a long time to practice the contempt of riches, and all at once to bear a loss that has happened.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:268
verses.text: Thus the loss becomes gain, and thou wilt not be injured, but even benefited by the devil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:269
verses.text: But how does the loss also become grievous? When thou losest thy soul! Tell me, the thief has deprived thee of thy possessions: wilt thou deprive thyself of salvation? Wherefore, grieving at the evils which thou hast suffered from others, dost thou plunge thyself into more evils? He perhaps has involved thee in poverty: but thou perversely injurest thyself in things that are fatal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:270
verses.text: He hath deprived thee of things that are without thee, and that hereafter would spring away from thee even against thy will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:271
verses.text: But thou deprivest thyself of the eternal riches.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:272
verses.text: The devil hath grieved thee by taking away thy wealth; do thou also grieve him, and do not delight him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:273
verses.text: If thou hast recourse to diviners, thou delightest him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:274
verses.text: If thou renderest thanks to God, thou givest him his death-blow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:275
verses.text: And see what happens.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:276
verses.text: Thou wilt not still find it, if thou goest to the diviners, for it is not in their power to know; and even if by any chance they have told thee, thou both losest thy own soul besides, and thou wilt be derided by thy brethren, and again wilt lose it wretchedly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:277
verses.text: For the demon, knowing that thou canst not bear thy loss, but for the sake of these things deniest even thy God, again gives thee wealth, that he may have an opportunity of deceiving thee again, and making thee fall away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:278
verses.text: And if the diviners should tell thee, wonder not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:279
verses.text: The demon is without body: he is everywhere going about.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:280
verses.text: It is he who arms the robbers themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:281
verses.text: For these things do not take place without the demon.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:282
verses.text: If therefore he arms them, he knows also where it is deposited.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:283
verses.text: He is not ignorant of his own ministers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:284
verses.text: And this is not wonderful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:285
verses.text: If he sees thee grieving at the loss, he adds yet another to it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:286
verses.text: If he sees thee laughing at it, and despising it, he will desist from this course.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:287
verses.text: For as we deal to our enemies those things by which we grieve them, but if we see that they do not grieve, we henceforth desist, as being unable to plague them; so does the devil also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:288
verses.text: What sayest thou? Dost thou not see those who sail on the sea, how, when a storm arises, they regard not their wealth, but even throw overboard their substance? "O man, what dost thou say? Art thou coöperating with the storm and the shipwreck? Before the wave has taken away thy wealth, dost thou do it with thine own hands? Why, before the shipwreck, dost thou wreck thyself?" But indeed a rustic inexperienced in the trials of the sea might say this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:289
verses.text: But the naval man, and one who truly knows what are the causes of calm, and what of storm, will even laugh at him who talks thus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:290
verses.text: For I throw it overboard, he says, that there may be no whelming sea.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:291
verses.text: So he who is experienced in the events and trials of life, when he sees the storm impending, and the spirits of evil wishing to cause shipwreck, throws overboard even the remainder of his wealth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:292
verses.text: Hast thou been plundered? Do alms, and thou lightenest the ship.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:293
verses.text: Have robbers ravaged thee? Give what remains to Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:294
verses.text: So thou wilt console thy poverty from thy former loss.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:295
verses.text: Lighten the ship, do not hold fast what remains, lest the vessel fill with water.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:296
verses.text: They, to preserve their bodies, throw their goods overboard, and wait not for the assailing wave to overturn the vessel.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:297
verses.text: And wilt thou not stay the shipwreck, that thou mayest save souls?  Make the trial, I beseech you—if you disbelieve, make the trial, and you will see the glory of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:298
verses.text: When anything grievous has happened, immediately give alms; render thanks that it has happened, and thou wilt see how much joy will come upon thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:299
verses.text: For spiritual gain, though it be small, is so great as to throw into the shade all bodily loss.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:300
verses.text: As long as thou hast to give to Christ, thou art rich.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:301
verses.text: Tell me, if when thou wast robbed, the king coming to thee held out his hand, begging to receive something from thee, wouldest thou not then think thyself richer than all, if the king not even after so great poverty was ashamed of thee? Be not carried away with thy wealth, only overcome thyself, and thou wilt overcome the assault of the devil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:302
verses.text: It is in thy power to acquire great gain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:303
verses.text: Let us despise wealth, that we may not despise the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:304
verses.text: But how can any one despise it? Dost thou not see in the case of beautiful bodies, and the lovers of them, how as long as they are in their sight the fire is kindled, the flame rises bright; but when any one has removed them afar off, all is extinguished, all is lulled to sleep; so also in the case of wealth, let no one provide gold, nor precious stones, nor necklaces; when seen, they ensnare the eyes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:305
verses.text: But if thou wouldest be rich like the ancients, be rich not in gold, but in necessary things, that thou mayest bestow on others from that which thou hast ready.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:306
verses.text: Be not fond of ornament.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:307
verses.text: Such wealth is both easy to be plotted against by robbers, and a thing that brings us cares.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:308
verses.text: Not vessels of gold and silver, but let there be stores of bread and wine and oil, not that being sold again they may procure money, but that they may be supplied to those who need.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 4:309
verses.text: If we withdraw ourselves from those superfluities, we shall obtain the heavenly goods; which God grant that we may all obtain, in Jesus Christ our Lord, with whom, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:1
verses.text: Homily IV.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:2
verses.text: Thessalonians iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:3
verses.text: –  "For this cause I also, when I could no longer forbear, sent that I might know your faith, lest by any means the tempter had tempted you, and our labor should be in vain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:4
verses.text: But when Timothy came even now unto us from you, and brought us glad tidings of your faith and love, and that ye have good remembrance of us always, longing to see us, even as we also to see you; for this cause, brethren, we were comforted over you in all our distress and affliction through your faith: for now we live, if ye stand fast in the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:5
verses.text: A question lies before us to-day, which is much disputed, and which is gathered from many sources.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:6
verses.text: But what is this question? "For this cause," he says, "when I could no longer forbear, I sent Timothy that I might know your faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:7
verses.text: What sayest thou? He, who knew so many things, who heard unutterable words, who ascended even to the third heaven, doth not he know, even when he is in Athens? And yet the distance is not great, nor has he been long parted from them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:8
verses.text: For he says, "Being bereaved of you for a short season".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:9
verses.text: He does not know the affairs of the Thessalonians, but is compelled to send Timothy to know their faith, "lest," he says, "the tempter had tempted you, and our labors should be in vain".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:10
verses.text: What then is one to say? That the Saints knew not all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:11
verses.text: And this one might learn from many instances, both of the early ones, and of those who came after them, as Elisha knew not concerning the woman ( Kings iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:12
verses.text: ); as Elijah said to God, "I only am left, and they seek my life".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:13
verses.text: Wherefore he heard from God, "I have left me seven thousand men".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:14
verses.text: ( Kings xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:15
verses.text: and.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:16
verses.text: ) Samuel again, when he was sent to anoint David; "The Lord said to him, Look not on his countenance, nor on the height of his stature; because I have rejected him: for God seeth not as man seeth; for man looketh on the outward appearance, but God looketh on the heart".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:17
verses.text: ( Sam.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:18
verses.text: xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:19
verses.text: )  And this comes to pass out of great care on God's part.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:20
verses.text: How, and in what way? For the sake both of the Saints themselves, and of those who believe in them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:21
verses.text: For as He permits that there should be persecutions, so He permits that they should also be ignorant of many things, that they may be kept humble.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:22
verses.text: On this account also Paul said, "There was given to me a thorn in the flesh, a messenger of Satan to buffet me, that I should not be exalted over much".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:23
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:24
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:25
verses.text: ) And again, lest others also should have great imaginations concerning them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:26
verses.text: For if they thought they were gods from their miracles, much more if they had continued always knowing all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:27
verses.text: And this again he also says: "Lest any man should account of me above that which he seeth me to be, or heareth from me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:28
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:29
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:30
verses.text: ) And again hear Peter, when he healed the lame man, saying, "Why fasten ye your eyes on us, as though by our own power or godliness we had made him to walk".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:31
verses.text: (Acts iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:32
verses.text: ) And if even when they were saying and doing these things, and from these few and small miracles, evil imaginations were thus engendered, much more would they have been from great ones.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:33
verses.text: But for another reason too these things were allowed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:34
verses.text: For that no one might be able to say it was as being other than men that they performed those excellent actions, and so all should become supine, he shows their infirmity, that from their folly he might cut off every pretext of shamelessness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:35
verses.text: For this reason he is ignorant, for this reason also, after having purposed, he frequently does not come, that they might perceive there were many things he knew not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:36
verses.text: Great advantage then came of this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:37
verses.text: For if there were some yet saying, "This man is that power of God which is called Great" (Acts viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:38
verses.text: ), and some, that it is this person, or that; unless these things had been so, what would they not have thought?  But here, however, there seems to be a censure on them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:39
verses.text: But quite otherwise, it even shows their admirable conduct, and proves the excess of their temptations.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:40
verses.text: How? Attend.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:41
verses.text: For if thou first sayest "that we are appointed thereunto," and "let no man be moved," why again dost thou send Timothy, fearing that something might happen which thou wouldest not wish.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:42
verses.text: This indeed he does from his great love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:43
verses.text: For those who love suspect even what is safe, from their exceeding warmth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:44
verses.text: But this is caused by their great temptations.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:45
verses.text: For I said indeed that we are appointed thereunto, but the excess of the temptations alarmed me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:46
verses.text: Wherefore he has not said, I send him as condemning you, but "when I could no longer forbear," which is rather an expression of love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:47
verses.text: What means, "Lest by any means the tempter had tempted you"? Dost thou see that to be shaken in afflictions proceeds from the devil, and from his seduction? For when he cannot shake us ourselves, he takes another way, and shakes the weaker sort through our means, which argues exceeding infirmity, and such as admits of no excuse; as he did in the case of Job, having stirred up his wife, "Speak some word against the Lord," she says, "and die".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:48
verses.text: (Job ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:49
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:50
verses.text: ) See how he tempted her.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:51
verses.text: But wherefore has he not said, "shaken," but "tempted"? Because, he says, I only suspected so much, as that you had been tempted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:52
verses.text: For he does not call his temptation a wavering.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:53
verses.text: For he who admits his attack is shaken.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:54
verses.text: Strange! how great is the affection of Paul! He did not regard afflictions, nor plots against him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:55
verses.text: For I think that he then remained there, as Luke says, that "he abode in Greece three months, when the Jews laid a plot against him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:56
verses.text: (Acts xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:57
verses.text: )  His concern therefore was not for his own dangers, but for his disciples.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:58
verses.text: Seest thou how he surpassed every natural parent? For we in our afflictions and dangers lose the remembrance of all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:59
verses.text: But he so feared and trembled for his children, that he sent to them Timothy, whom alone he had for his consolation, his companion and fellow-laborer, and him too in the very midst of dangers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:60
verses.text: "And our labor," he says, "should be in vain".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:61
verses.text: Wherefore! for even if they were turned aside, it was not through thy fault, not through thy negligence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:62
verses.text: But nevertheless, though this were the case, I think, from my great love of the brethren, that my labor had been rendered vain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:63
verses.text: "Lest by any means the tempter had tempted you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:64
verses.text: But he tempts, not knowing whether he shall overthrow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:65
verses.text: Does he then, even though he knows not, yet assail us, and do we, who know that we shall completely overcome him, not watch? But that he does attack us, though he knows not, he showed in the case of Job.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:66
verses.text: For that evil demon said to God, "Hast Thou not made a hedge about his things within, and his things without? Take away his goods, and surely he will bless Thee to Thy face".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:67
verses.text: (Job i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:68
verses.text: , , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:69
verses.text: ) He makes trial; if he sees anything weak, he makes an attack, if strong, he desists.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:70
verses.text: "And our labor," he says, "be in vain".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:71
verses.text: Let us all hear, how Paul labored.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:72
verses.text: He does not say work, but "labor"; he does not say, and you be lost, but "our labor".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:73
verses.text: So that even if anything had happened, it would be happening with some reason.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:74
verses.text: But that it did not happen was a great wonder.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:75
verses.text: These things indeed we expected, he says, but the contrary happened.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:76
verses.text: For not only did we receive from you no addition to our affliction but even consolation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:77
verses.text: "But when Timothy came even now unto us, and brought us glad tidings of your faith and love".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:78
verses.text: "Brought us glad tidings," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:79
verses.text: Do you see the excessive joy of Paul? he does not say, brought us word, but "brought us glad tidings".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:80
verses.text: So great a good did he think their steadfastness and love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:81
verses.text: For it was necessary, the one remaining firm, that the other also must be steadfast.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:82
verses.text: And he rejoiced in their love, because it was a sign of their faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:83
verses.text: "And that ye have," he says, "good remembrance of us always, longing to see us, even as we also to see you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:84
verses.text: That is, with praises.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:85
verses.text: Not when we were present, nor when we were working miracles, but even now, when we are far off, and are scourged, and are suffering numberless evils, "ye have good remembrance of us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:86
verses.text: Hear how disciples are admired, who have good remembrance of their teachers, how they are called blessed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:87
verses.text: Let us imitate these.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:88
verses.text: For we benefit ourselves, not those who are loved by us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:89
verses.text: "Longing to see us," he says, "as we also to see you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:90
verses.text: And this too cheered them; for to him who loves, to perceive that the beloved person knows that he is beloved, is a great comfort and consolation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:91
verses.text: "For this cause, brethren, we were comforted over you in all our distress and affliction through your faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:92
verses.text: For now we live if ye stand fast in the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:93
verses.text: What is comparable to Paul, who thought the salvation of his neighbors was his own, being so affected towards all, as really towards members? Who now would be able to break forth into such speech? Or rather, who will ever be able to have such a thought? He did not require them to be thankful to him for the trials which he suffered for them, but he was thankful to them that they were not moved on account of his trials.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:94
verses.text: As if he had said, that to you rather than to us was injury done by those trials; you were tempted rather than we, you who suffered nothing, rather than we who suffered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:95
verses.text: Because, he says, Timothy brought us these good tidings, we feel nothing of our sorrows, but were comforted in all our affliction; not in this affliction only.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:96
verses.text: For nothing besides can touch a good teacher, as long as the affairs of his disciples go on to his mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:97
verses.text: Through you, he says, we were comforted; you confirmed us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:98
verses.text: And yet the reverse was the case.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:99
verses.text: For that when suffering they did not yield, but stood manfully, was sufficient to confirm the disciples.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:100
verses.text: But he reverses the whole matter, and turns the encomium over to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:101
verses.text: You have anointed us, he says, you have caused us to breathe again; you have not suffered us to feel our trials.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:102
verses.text: And he has not said, we breathe again, nor we are comforted, but what? "Now we live," showing that he thinks nothing is either trial or death, but their stumbling, whereas their advancement was even life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:103
verses.text: How else could any one have set forth either the sorrow for the weakness of one's disciples, or the joy? He has not said we rejoice, but "we live," the life to come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:104
verses.text: So that without this we do not even think it life to live.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:105
verses.text: So ought teachers to be affected, so disciples; and there will be nothing at any time amiss.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:106
verses.text: Then further softening the expression, see what he says,  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:108
verses.text: "For what thanksgiving can we render again unto God for you, for all the joy wherewith we joy for your sakes before our God; night and day praying exceedingly that we may see your face, and may perfect that which is lacking in your faith?"  Not only, he says, are ye the causes of life to us, but also of much joy, and so much that we cannot worthily give thanks to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:109
verses.text: Your good behavior, he says, we consider to be the gift of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:110
verses.text: Such kindnesses have you shown to us, that we think it to be of God; yea, rather, and it is of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:111
verses.text: For such a disposition of mind comes not of a human soul or carefulness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:112
verses.text: "Night and day," he says, "praying exceedingly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:113
verses.text: This too is a sign of joy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:114
verses.text: For as any husbandman, hearing concerning his land that has been tilled by himself, that it is burdened with ears of grain, longs with his own eyes to see so pleasant a sight, so Paul to see Macedonia.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:115
verses.text: "Praying exceedingly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:116
verses.text: Observe the excess; "that we may see your face, and may perfect that which is lacking in your faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:117
verses.text: Here there is a great question.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:118
verses.text: For if now thou livest, because they stand fast, and Timothy brought thee "glad tidings of their faith and love," and thou art full of so much joy as not to be able worthily to give thanks to God, how sayest thou here that there are deficiencies in their faith? Were those then the words of flattery? By no means, far be it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:119
verses.text: For previously he testified that they endured many conflicts, and were no worse affected than the Churches in Judaea.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:120
verses.text: What then is it? They had not enjoyed the full benefit of his teaching, nor learned all that it behoved them to learn.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:121
verses.text: And this he shows toward the end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:122
verses.text: Perhaps there had been questionings among them concerning the Resurrection, and there were many who troubled them, not by temptations, nor by dangers, but by acting the part of teachers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:123
verses.text: This is what he says is lacking in their faith, and for this reason, he has so explained himself, and has not said, that you should be confirmed, where indeed he feared concerning the faith itself, "I have sent," he says, "Timothy 'to confirm you,'" but here, "to perfect that which is lacking," which is rather a matter of teaching than of confirming.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:124
verses.text: As also he says elsewhere, "that ye may be perfected unto every good work".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:125
verses.text: (From  Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:126
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:127
verses.text: , or  Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:128
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:129
verses.text: ) Now the perfected thing is one in which there is some little deficiency: for it is that which is brought to perfection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:130
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:132
verses.text: "Now may our God and Father Himself, and our Lord Jesus Christ direct our way unto you: and the Lord make you to increase and abound in love one toward another, and toward all men, even as we also do toward you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:133
verses.text: This is a proof of excessive love, that he not only prays for them by himself, but even in his Epistles inserts his prayer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:134
verses.text: This argues a fervent soul, and one truly not to be restrained.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:135
verses.text: This is a proof of the prayers made there also, and at the same time also an excuse, as showing that it was not voluntarily, nor from indolence, that they did not go to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:136
verses.text: As if he had said, May God Himself cut short the temptations that everywhere distract us, so that we may come directly to you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:137
verses.text: "And the Lord make you to increase and abound".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:138
verses.text: Do you see the unrestrainable madness of love that is shown by his words? "Make you to increase and abound," instead of cause you to grow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:139
verses.text: As if one should say, that with a kind of superabundance he desires to be loved by them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:140
verses.text: "Even as we do also toward you," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:141
verses.text: Our part is already done, we pray that yours may be done.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:142
verses.text: Do you see how he wishes love to be extended, not only toward one another, but everywhere? For this truly is the nature of godly love, that it embraces all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:143
verses.text: If you love indeed such an one, but do not love such an one, it is human love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:144
verses.text: But such is not ours.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:145
verses.text: "Even as we do also toward you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:146
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:147
verses.text: "To the end He may establish your hearts unblamable in holiness before our God and Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ with all His saints".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:148
verses.text: He shows that love produces advantage to themselves, not to those who are loved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:149
verses.text: I wish, he says, that this love may abound, that there may be no blemish.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:150
verses.text: He does not say to stablish you, but your hearts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:151
verses.text: "For out of the heart come forth evil thoughts".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:152
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:153
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:154
verses.text: ) For it is possible, without doing anything, to be a bad man; as for example, to have envy, unbelief, deceit, to rejoice at evils, not to be loving, to hold perverted doctrines, all these things are of the heart; and to be pure of these things is holiness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:155
verses.text: For indeed chastity is properly by preëminence called holiness, since fornication and adultery is also uncleanness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:156
verses.text: But universally all sin is uncleanness, and every virtue is purity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:157
verses.text: For, "Blessed," it is said, "are the pure in heart".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:158
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:159
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:160
verses.text: ) By "the pure" He means those who are in every way pure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:161
verses.text: For other things also know how to pollute the soul, and no less.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:162
verses.text: For that wickedness defiles the soul, hear the prophet, saying, "O Jerusalem, wash thine heart from wickedness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:163
verses.text: (Jer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:164
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:165
verses.text: ) And again, "Wash you, make you clean, put away the wickednesses from your souls".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:166
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:167
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:168
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:169
verses.text: ) He did not say "fornications," so that not only fornication, but other things also defile the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:170
verses.text: "To establish your hearts," he says, "unblamable in holiness before our God and Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ with all His saints".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:171
verses.text: Therefore Christ will then be a Judge, but not before Him (only), but also before the Father we shall stand to be judged.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:172
verses.text: Or does he mean this, to be unblamable before God, as he always says, "in the sight of God," for this is sincere virtue—not in the sight of men?  It is love then that makes them unblamable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:173
verses.text: For it does make men really unblamable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:174
verses.text: And once when I was discoursing of this to a certain one, and saying, that love makes men unblamable, and that love to our neighbor does not suffer any entrance of transgression, and in my discourse going over, and pursuing all the rest—some one of my acquaintance interposing himself said, What then of fornication, is it not possible both to love, and to commit fornication? And it is indeed from love that this springs.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:175
verses.text: Covetousness indeed, and adultery, and envy, and hostile designs, and everything of this sort can, from love of one's neighbor, be stopped; but how fornication? he said.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:176
verses.text: I therefore told him, that even this can love stop.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:177
verses.text: For if a man should love a woman that commits fornication, he will endeavor both to draw her off from other men, and not himself also to add to her sin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:178
verses.text: So that to commit fornication with a woman is the part of one exceedingly hating her with whom he commits the fornication, but one who truly loved her would withdraw her from that abominable practice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:179
verses.text: And there is not, there is not any sin, which the power of love, like fire, cannot consume.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:180
verses.text: For it is easier for a vile faggot to resist a great pile of fire, than for the nature of sin to resist the power of love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:181
verses.text: This then let us plant in our own souls, that we may stand with all the Saints.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:182
verses.text: For they all pleased God by their love to their neighbor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:183
verses.text: Whence was Abel slain, and did not slay? From his vehement love to his brother, he could not even admit such a thought.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:184
verses.text: Whence was the destructive pest of envy received by Cain? For I will no longer call him the brother of Abel! Because the foundations of love had not been firmly fixed in him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:185
verses.text: Whence did the sons of Noah obtain a good report? was it not because they vehemently loved their father, and did not endure to see his exposure? And whence was the other cursed? was it not from not loving him? And whence did Abraham obtain a good report? was it not from love in doing what he did concerning his nephew? what he did as to his supplication for the Sodomites? For strongly, strongly, were the Saints affected with love and with sympathy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:186
verses.text: For consider, I pray; Paul, he that was bold in the face of fire, hard as adamant, firm and unshaken, on every side compact, riveted in the fear of God, and inflexible; for, "who (said he) shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall tribulation, or anguish, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword"? (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:187
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:188
verses.text: ) he that was bold in the face of all these things, and of earth and sea, he that laughed to scorn the adamantine gates of death, whom nothing ever withstood,—he, when he saw the tears of some whom he loved, was so broken and crushed,—the adamantine man,—that he did not even conceal his feelings, but said straightway, "What do ye, weeping and breaking my heart?" (Acts xxi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:189
verses.text: ) What sayest thou, tell me? Had a tear the power to crush that soul of adamant? Yea, he says, for I hold out against all things except love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:190
verses.text: This prevails over me, and subdues me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:191
verses.text: This is the mind of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:192
verses.text: An abyss of water did not crush him, and a few tears crushed him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:193
verses.text: "What do ye, weeping and crushing my heart?" For great is the force of love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:194
verses.text: Dost thou not see him again weeping? Why weepest thou? Tell me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:195
verses.text: "By the space of three years," he says, "I ceased not to admonish every one night and day with tears".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:196
verses.text: (Acts xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:197
verses.text: ) From his great love he feared, lest some plague should be introduced among them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:198
verses.text: And again, "For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote unto you with many tears".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:199
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:200
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:201
verses.text: )  And what did Joseph? tell me, that firm one, who stood up against so great a tyranny, who appears so noble against so great a flame of love, who so out-battled and overcame the madness of his mistress.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:202
verses.text: For what was there not then to charm him? A beautiful person, the pride of rank, the costliness of garments, the fragrance of perfumes, (for all these things know how to soften the soul,) words more soft than all the rest! For ye know that she who loves, and so vehemently, nothing so humble but she will bring herself to say it, taking upon her the attitude of a supplicant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:203
verses.text: For so broken was this woman, though wearing gold, and being of royal dignity, that she threw herself at the knees perhaps of the captive boy, and perhaps even intreated him weeping and clasping his knees, and had recourse to this not once, and a second time, but oftentimes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:204
verses.text: Then he might see her eye shining most brilliantly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:205
verses.text: For it is probable that she not simply but with excessive nicety would set off her beauty; as wishing by many nets to catch the lamb of Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:206
verses.text: Add here I pray also many magic charms.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:207
verses.text: Yet nevertheless this inflexible, this firm man, of rocky hardness, when he saw his brothers who had bartered him away, who had thrown him into a pit, who had sold him, who had even wished to murder him, who were the causes both of the prison and the honor, when he heard from them how they had worked upon their father, (for, we said, it says, that one was devoured by a wild beast Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:208
verses.text: xxxvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:209
verses.text: , and lxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:210
verses.text: ,) he was broken, softened, crushed, "And he wept," it says, and not being able to bear his feelings, he went in, and composed himself (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:211
verses.text: xliii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:212
verses.text: ), that is, wiped away his tears.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:213
verses.text: What is this? dost thou weep, O Joseph? and yet the present circumstances are deserving not of tears, but of anger, and wrath, and indignation, and great revenge and retribution.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:214
verses.text: Thou hast thine enemies in thy hands, those fratricides; thou canst satiate thy wrath.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:215
verses.text: And yet neither would this be injustice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:216
verses.text: For thou dost not thyself begin the unjust acts, but defendest thyself against those who have done the wrong.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:217
verses.text: For look not to thy dignity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:218
verses.text: This was not of their contrivance, but of God, who shed His favor upon thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:219
verses.text: Why dost thou weep? But he would have said, far be it that I, who in all things have obtained a good report, should by this remembrance of wrongs overturn them all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:220
verses.text: It is truly a season for tears.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:221
verses.text: I am not more brutish than beasts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:222
verses.text: They pour out a libation to nature, whatever harm they suffer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:223
verses.text: I weep, he says, that they ever treated me thus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:224
verses.text: This man let us also imitate.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:225
