verses.text: Let us mourn and weep for those who have injured us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:226
verses.text: Let us not be angry with them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:227
verses.text: For truly they are worthy of tears, for the punishment and condemnation to which they make themselves liable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:228
verses.text: I know, how you now weep, how you rejoice, both admiring Paul, and amazed at Joseph, and pronouncing them blessed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:229
verses.text: But if any one has an enemy, let him now take him into recollection, let him bring him to his mind, that whilst his heart is yet warm with the remembrance of the Saints, he may be enabled to dissolve the stubbornness of wrath, and to soften what is harsh and callous.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:230
verses.text: I know, that after your departure hence, after that I have ceased speaking, if anything of warmth and fervor should remain, it will not be so great, as it now is whilst you are hearing me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:231
verses.text: If therefore any one, if any one has become cold, let him dissolve the frost.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:232
verses.text: For the remembrance of injuries is truly frost and ice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:233
verses.text: But let us invoke the Sun of Righteousness, let us entreat Him to send His beams upon us, and there will no longer be thick ice, but water to drink.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:234
verses.text: If the fire of the Sun of Righteousness has touched our souls, it will leave nothing frozen, nothing hard, nothing burning, nothing unfruitful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:235
verses.text: It will bring out all things ripe, all things sweet, all things abounding with much pleasure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:236
verses.text: If we love one another, that beam also will come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:237
verses.text: Allow me, I beseech you, to say these things with earnestness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:238
verses.text: Cause me to hear, that by these words we have produced some effect; that some one has gone and thrown both his arms about his enemy, has embraced him, has twined himself around him, has warmly kissed him, has wept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:239
verses.text: And though the other be a wild beast, a stone, or whatever he be, he will be made gentle by such affectionate kindness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:240
verses.text: For on what account is he thine enemy? Hath he insulted thee? yet he has not injured thee at all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:241
verses.text: But dost thou for the sake of money suffer thy brother to be at enmity with thee? Do not so, I beseech you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:242
verses.text: Let us do away all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:243
verses.text: It is our season.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:244
verses.text: Let us use it to good purpose.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:245
verses.text: Let us cut asunder the cords of our sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:246
verses.text: Before we go away to judgment, let us not ourselves judge one another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:247
verses.text: "Let not the sun" (it is said) "go down upon your wrath".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:248
verses.text: (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:249
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:250
verses.text: ) Let no one put it off.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:251
verses.text: These puttings off produce delays.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:252
verses.text: If you have deferred it to-day, you blush the more, and if you add to-morrow, the shame is greater, and if a third day, yet worse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:253
verses.text: Let us not then put ourselves to shame, but let us forgive, that we may be forgiven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 5:254
verses.text: And if we be forgiven, we shall obtain all blessings, through Jesus Christ our Lord, with whom, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:1
verses.text: Homily V.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:2
verses.text: Thessalonians iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:3
verses.text: –  "Finally then, brethren, we beseech and exhort you in the Lord Jesus, that, as ye received of us how ye ought to walk and to please God, so ye abound more and more.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:4
verses.text: For ye know what charge we gave you through the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:5
verses.text: For this is the will of God, even your sanctification".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:6
verses.text: When he has met what was pressing, and what was upon his hands, and is about henceforth to enter upon things that are perpetual, and which they ought continually to hear, he adds this expression, "finally," that is, always and forever.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:7
verses.text: "We beseech and exhort you in the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:8
verses.text: Strange! He does not even speak of himself as of sufficient credit to exhort.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:9
verses.text: And yet who was so worthy of credit? But he takes Christ along with him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:10
verses.text: We exhort you, he says, by God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:11
verses.text: Which also he said to the Corinthians, "God entreats (exhorts) you through us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:12
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:13
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:14
verses.text: ) "That as ye received of us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:15
verses.text: This "received" is not of words only, but of actions also, viz.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:16
verses.text: "how ye ought to walk," and he means thereby the whole conduct of life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:17
verses.text: "And to please God, that ye abound more and more".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:18
verses.text: That is, that by more abounding ye do not stop at the limit of the commandments, but that you even go beyond them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:19
verses.text: For this it is, that "ye abound more and more".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:20
verses.text: In what preceded he accepts the marvel of their firm faith, but here he regulates their life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:21
verses.text: For this is proficiency, even to go beyond the commandments and the statutes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:22
verses.text: For no longer from the constraint of a teacher, but from their own voluntary choice, is all this performed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:23
verses.text: For as the earth ought not to bear only what is thrown upon it, so too ought the soul not to stop at those things which have been inculcated, but to go beyond them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:24
verses.text: Do you see that he has properly said "to go beyond"? For virtue is divided into these two things, to decline from evil, and to do good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:25
verses.text: For the withdrawal from evil is not sufficient for the arrival at virtue, but it is a kind of path, and a beginning leading thereto; still we have need of great alacrity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:26
verses.text: The things therefore to be avoided he tells them in the order of commandment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:27
verses.text: And justly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:28
verses.text: For these things indeed being done bring punishment, but not being done, yet bring no praise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:29
verses.text: The acts of virtue however, such as to give away our goods, and such like, are not of the order of commandment, he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:30
verses.text: But what? "He that is able to receive, let him receive".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:31
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:32
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:33
verses.text: ) It is profitable, therefore, that as he with much fear and trembling had given these commandments to them, he also by these letters reminds them of that his care.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:34
verses.text: Wherefore he does not repeat them, but reminds them of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:35
verses.text: "For ye know," he says, "what charge we gave you through our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:36
verses.text: For this is the will of God, even your sanctification".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:37
verses.text: And observe how he nowhere so vehemently glances at any other thing, as at this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:38
verses.text: As elsewhere also he writes to this effect; "Follow after peace with all men, and the sanctification without which no man shall see the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:39
verses.text: (Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:40
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:41
verses.text: ) And why dost thou wonder, if he everywhere writes to his disciples upon this subject, when even in his Epistle to Timothy he has said, "Keep thyself pure".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:42
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:43
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:44
verses.text: ) Also in his second Epistle to the Corinthians he has said, "In much patience, in fastings, by pureness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:45
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:46
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:48
verses.text: ) And one may find this in many places, both in this Epistle to the Romans, and everywhere, and in all his Epistles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:49
verses.text: For in truth this is an evil pernicious to all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:50
verses.text: And as a swine full charged with mire, wherever he enters, fills all places with his ill odor, and chokes the senses with dung, so too does fornication; it is an evil not easy to be washed away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:51
verses.text: But when some even who have wives practice this, how excessive is the outrage! "For this," he says, "is the will of God, even your sanctification, that ye abstain from all fornication".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:52
verses.text: For there are many forms of disorderly conduct.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:53
verses.text: The pleasures of wantonness are of many kinds and various, it were not tolerable to mention them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:54
verses.text: But having said "from all fornication," he leaves it to those who know them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:55
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:57
verses.text: "That each one of you know how to possess himself of his own vessel in sanctification and honor, not in the passion of lust, even as the Gentiles which know not God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:58
verses.text: He says, "That each one of you know how to possess himself of his own vessel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:59
verses.text: It is, then, a matter to be learnt, and that diligently, not to be wanton.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:60
verses.text: But we possess our vessel, when it is pure; when it is impure, sin possesses it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:61
verses.text: And reasonably.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:62
verses.text: For it does not do the things which we wish, but what sin commands.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:63
verses.text: "Not in the passion of lust," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:64
verses.text: Here he shows also the manner, according to which one ought to be temperate; that we should cut off the passions of lust.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:65
verses.text: For luxury, and wealth, and idleness, and sloth, and ease, and all such things, lead us on to irregular lust.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:66
verses.text: "Even as the Gentiles," he says, "which know not God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:67
verses.text: For such are they who do not expect that they shall suffer punishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:68
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:69
verses.text: "That no man transgress, and wrong his brother in the matter".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:70
verses.text: He has well said, "that no man transgress".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:71
verses.text: To each man God has assigned a wife, he has set bounds to nature, that intercourse with one only: therefore intercourse with another is transgression, and the taking of more than belongs to one, and robbery; or rather it is more cruel than any robbery; for we grieve not so much, when our riches are carried off, as when marriage is invaded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:72
verses.text: Dost thou call him brother, and wrongest him, and that in things which are unlawful? Here he speaks concerning adultery, but above also concerning "all fornication".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:73
verses.text: For since he was about to say, "That no man transgress and wrong his brother," Do not think, he says, that I say this only in the case of brethren; you must not have the wives of others at all, nor even women that have no husbands, and that are common.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:74
verses.text: You must abstain from "all fornication"; "Because," he says, "the Lord is an avenger in all these things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:75
verses.text: He exhorted them first, he shamed them, saying, "even as the Gentiles".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:76
verses.text: Then from reasonings he showed the impropriety of defrauding a brother.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:77
verses.text: Afterwards he adds the principal thing; "Because," he says, "the Lord is an avenger in all these things, as also we forewarned you and testified".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:78
verses.text: For we do not these things without being punished, neither do we enjoy so much pleasure, as we undergo punishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:79
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:80
verses.text: "For God called us not for uncleanness, but in sanctification".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:81
verses.text: Because he had said "his brother," and had also added, that God is the avenger, showing that even if an unbeliever has suffered this, he who has done it shall suffer punishment, he says, it is not as avenging him that He punishes thee, but because thou hast insulted Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:82
verses.text: He Himself called thee, thou hast insulted Him who called thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:83
verses.text: On this account, he has added,  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:84
verses.text: "Therefore he that rejecteth, rejecteth not man, but God, who giveth His Holy Spirit unto you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:85
verses.text: So that even if thou shouldest defile the Empress, he says, or even thine own handmaid, that hath a husband, the crime is the same.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:86
verses.text: Why? Because He avenges not the persons that are injured, but Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:87
verses.text: For thou art equally defiled, thou hast equally insulted God; for both the one and the other is adultery, as both the one and the other is marriage.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:88
verses.text: And though thou shouldest not commit adultery, but fornication, though the harlot has no husband, yet nevertheless God avenges, for He avenges Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:89
verses.text: For thou dost this act, not despising the man, so much as God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:90
verses.text: And it is manifest from this, that thou doest it concealing it from man, but thou pretendest that God doth not see thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:91
verses.text: For tell me, if one who was thought worthy of the purple, and of infinite honor from the king (Emperor), and was commanded to live suitably to the honor, should go and defile himself with any woman; whom has he insulted? her, or the king who gave him all? She indeed is insulted too, but not equally.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:92
verses.text: Wherefore, I beseech you, let us guard against this sin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:93
verses.text: For as we punish women, when, being married to us, they give themselves to others, so also are we punished, though not by the Roman laws, yet by God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:94
verses.text: For this also is adultery.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:95
verses.text: For not only is adultery committed in doing so by her who is married to another, but by him also, who is yoked to a wife.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:96
verses.text: Attend carefully to what I say.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:97
verses.text: For although what is said is offensive to many, it is necessary to be said, to set the matter right for the future.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:98
verses.text: Not only is this adultery, when we defile a woman who is married to a man; but if we ourselves being married to a woman defile one who is free and disengaged, the matter is adultery.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:99
verses.text: For what, if she with whom the adultery is committed is not bound? Yet art thou bound.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:100
verses.text: Thou hast transgressed the law.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:101
verses.text: Thou hast injured thine own flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:102
verses.text: For tell me, wherefore dost thou punish thy wife, if she commit fornication with a man who is loosed, and has not a wife? Because it is adultery.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:103
verses.text: Why? Yet he who defiled her has not a wife, but she is bound to a husband.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:104
verses.text: Well then, thou also art bound to a wife; so that in like manner thy offence also is adultery.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:105
verses.text: For it is said, "Every one that putteth away his wife, saving for the cause of fornication, maketh her an adulteress: and whosoever shall marry her when she is put away, committeth adultery".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:106
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:107
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:108
verses.text: ) If he who marries her who is divorced commits adultery, he who, with a wife of his own, defiles himself also with that other—it is manifest to every one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:109
verses.text: But perhaps to you who are men, enough has been said on this subject.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:110
verses.text: For concerning them that are such, Christ says, "Their worm will not die and the fire will not be quenched".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:111
verses.text: (Mark ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:112
verses.text: ) But for the sake of the young it is necessary to speak to you, not to the young themselves so much, but to you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:113
verses.text: For these things are suitable not to them only, but also to you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:114
verses.text: And how? I will now tell you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:115
verses.text: He who has not learnt to commit fornication, will neither know how to commit adultery.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:116
verses.text: But he who walloweth among harlots, will quickly also arrive at the other, and will defile himself, if not with the married, yet with those who are disengaged.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:117
verses.text: What then do I advise, so as to extirpate the roots? So many of you as have young sons, and are bringing them up to a worldly life, quickly draw them under the yoke of marriage.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:118
verses.text: For since whilst he is yet young desires trouble him, for the time before marriage, by admonitions, threats, fears, promises, and numberless other methods restrain them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:119
verses.text: But at the season of marriage, let no one defer it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:120
verses.text: Behold, I speak the words of a match-maker, that you should let your sons marry.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:121
verses.text: But I am not ashamed to speak thus, since not even Paul was ashamed to say, "Defraud ye not one the other" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:122
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:123
verses.text: ), which seems more shameful than what I have said; yet he was not ashamed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:124
verses.text: For he did not pay heed to words, but to the acts that were set right by words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:125
verses.text: When thy son is grown up, before he enters upon warfare, or any other course of life, consider of his marriage.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:126
verses.text: And if he sees that thou wilt soon take a bride for him, and that the time intervening will be short, he will be able to endure the flame patiently.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:127
verses.text: But if he perceives that thou art remiss and slow, and waitest until he shall acquire a large income, and then thou wilt contract a marriage for him, despairing at the length of the time, he will readily fall into fornication.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:128
verses.text: But alas! the root of evils here also is the love of money.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:129
verses.text: For since no one cares how far his son shall be sober and modest, but all are mad for gold, for this reason no one makes this a matter of concern.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:130
verses.text: Wherefore I exhort you first to regulate well their souls.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:131
verses.text: If he find his bride chaste, and know that body alone, then will both his desire be vehement, and his fear of God the greater, and the marriage truly honorable, receiving bodies pure and undefiled; and the offspring will be full-charged with blessing, and the bride and bridegroom will comply with one another, for both being inexperienced in the manners of others, they will submit to one another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:132
verses.text: But one that begins when younger to wax wanton, and to have experience of the ways of harlots, for the first and second evening will praise his own wife; but after that he will soon fall back into that wantonness, seeking that dissolute and disorderly laughter, the words that are full of base import, the dissolute deportment, and all the other indecency, which it is not tolerable that we should mention.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:133
verses.text: But a woman of free estate would not endure to make such exhibitions, nor to tarnish herself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:134
verses.text: For she was espoused to her husband to be his partner in life, and for the procreation of children, not for the purposes of indecency and laughter; that she might keep the house, and instruct him also to be grave, not that she might supply to him the fuel of fornication.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:135
verses.text: But the gestures of a harlot seem to you agreeable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:136
verses.text: I know it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:137
verses.text: For the Scripture says, "The lips of a strange woman drop honey".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:138
verses.text: (Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:139
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:140
verses.text: ) For on this account I take all this trouble, that ye may have no experience of that honey, for it straightway turns into gall.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:141
verses.text: And this also the Scripture says, "Who for a season is smooth to thy throat, but afterwards thou shalt find her more bitter than gall, and sharper than a two-edged sword".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:142
verses.text: (Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:143
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:144
verses.text: , , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:145
verses.text: ) What sayest thou? Bear with me speaking somewhat impure, if I may say so—and expressing myself as one shameless and unblushing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:146
verses.text: For I do not submit to this willingly, but on account of those who are shameless in their actions, I am compelled to speak this sort of words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:147
verses.text: And many such we see even in the Scriptures.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:148
verses.text: For even Ezekiel, reproaching Jerusalem, utters many such things, and is not ashamed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:149
verses.text: And justly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:150
verses.text: For he did not say them from his own inclination, but from his concern.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:151
verses.text: For although the words seem to be indecent, yet his aim is not indecent, but even highly becoming one who wishes to banish uncleanness from the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:152
verses.text: For if the shameless soul does not hear the very words, it is not affected.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:153
verses.text: For a physician wishing to remove a putrid sore, first thrusts his fingers into the wound, and if he does not first defile his healing hands, he will not be able to cure it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:154
verses.text: So it is with me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:155
verses.text: Unless I first defile my mouth, that heals your passions, I shall not be able to heal you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:156
verses.text: But rather neither is my mouth defiled, nor his hands.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:157
verses.text: Why then? Because the uncleanness is not that of nature, nor from our own body, as neither in that case from his hands, but from what is another's.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:158
verses.text: But if where the body is another's, he does not refuse to dip his own hands, tell me, shall we refuse, where it is our own body? For you are our body, sickly indeed and impure, but ours nevertheless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:159
verses.text: What then is this which I say, and for which I have made so long a digression? A garment indeed which your slave wears, you would not choose ever to wear, being disgusted on account of its filth, but you would rather go naked than make use of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:160
verses.text: But a body that is unclean and filthy, and which is used not only by your slave, but by numberless others, that will you abuse, and not be disgusted? Are you ashamed at hearing this? But be ashamed of the actions, not of the words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:161
verses.text: And I pass over all other things, the rudeness, and the corruption of their manners, the servility and illiberality of the rest of their life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:162
verses.text: Tell me, should you and your servant go to the same woman? and I wish it were only your servant, and not, it may be, the executioner! And yet you could not bear to take the executioner by the hand; but her who has been made one body with him you kiss and embrace, and do not shudder, nor fear! Are, you not ashamed? are you not abashed? are you not pierced with anguish?  I said indeed to your fathers, that they ought early to lead you to marriage: but nevertheless neither are you without liability to punishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:163
verses.text: For if there were not other young men also, more numerous than you, living in chastity, both formerly, and now, there would perhaps be some excuse for you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:164
verses.text: But if there are, how can you say, that we were not able to restrain the flame of lust? For they, who have been able, are your accusers, in that they are partakers of the same nature.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:165
verses.text: Hear Paul saying, "Follow after peace…and the sanctification, without which no man shall see the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:166
verses.text: (Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:167
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:168
verses.text: ) Is not this threat sufficient to terrify you? Do you see others continuing altogether in chastity, and in gravity passing their lives; and cannot you command yourself even so long as the period of youth? Do you see others ten thousand times overcoming pleasure, and cannot you once refrain? With your leave, I will tell you the cause.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:169
verses.text: For youth is not the cause, since then all young men would be dissolute.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:170
verses.text: But we thrust ourselves into the fire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:171
verses.text: For when you go up to the theater, and sit feasting your eyes with the naked limbs of women, for the time indeed you are delighted, but afterwards, you have nourished thence a mighty fever.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:172
verses.text: When you see women exhibited as it were in the form of their bodies and spectacles and songs containing nothing else but irregular loves: such a woman, it is said, loved such a man, and not obtaining him, hanged herself; and unlawful loves having mothers for their object; when you receive these things by hearing also, and through women, and through figures, yea, and even through old men, (for many there put masks upon their faces, and play the parts of women,) tell me, how will you be able to continue chaste afterwards, these narratives, these spectacles, these songs occupying your soul, and dreams of this sort henceforth succeeding.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:173
verses.text: For it is the nature of the soul for the most part to raise visions of such things, as it wishes for and desires in the daytime.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:174
verses.text: Therefore when you there both see base actions, and hear baser words, and receive indeed the wounds but do not apply the remedies, how will not the sore naturally be increased? how will not the disease become more intense; and in a much greater degree than in our bodies? For if we were willing, our will admits of correction more easily than our bodies.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:175
verses.text: For there indeed drugs, and physicians, and time are required, but here it is sufficient having but the will, to become both good and bad.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:176
verses.text: So that you have rather admitted the disorder.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:177
verses.text: When therefore we gather to us indeed the things that injure, but pay no regard to the things that benefit, how can there ever be any health?  On this account Paul said, "even as the Gentiles who knew not God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:178
verses.text: Let us be ashamed, let us be afraid, if the Gentiles, that know not God, are often chaste.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:179
verses.text: Let us turn for shame, when we are worse than they.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:180
verses.text: It is easy to achieve chastity, if we will, if we withdraw ourselves from those things that are injurious, since it is not even easy to avoid fornication, if we will not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:181
verses.text: For what is more easy than to walk in the market-place? but from the excess of laziness it is become difficult, not only in the case of women, but sometimes even in that of men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:182
verses.text: What is more easy than to sleep? but we have made even this difficult.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:183
verses.text: Many however of the rich toss themselves through a whole night, from their not waiting for the need of sleep, and then sleeping.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:184
verses.text: And in short nothing is difficult, when men are willing; as nothing is easy, when they are unwilling; for we are masters of all these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:185
verses.text: On this account the Scripture says, "If ye be willing and hear me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:186
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:187
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:188
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:189
verses.text: ) And again, "If ye be unwilling, and hear not".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:190
verses.text: (Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:191
verses.text: ) So that all depends upon being willing or unwilling.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:192
verses.text: On this account we both are punished and are praised.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 6:193
verses.text: But may it be ours, being of those who are praised, to obtain the promised blessings, by the grace and lovingkindness, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:1
verses.text: Homily VI.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:2
verses.text: Thessalonians iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:3
verses.text: ,  "But concerning love of the brethren wehave no need to write unto you: for ye yourselves are taught of God to love one another; for indeed ye do it toward all the brethren, and those which are in all Macedonia".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:4
verses.text: Why then having discoursed with them earnestly concerning chastity, and being about to discourse about the duty of working, and about the not sorrowing for the departed, does he introduce that which was the principal of all good things, love, as if he were passing it over, saying, "We have no need to write to you"? This also is from his great wisdom, and belongs to spiritual instruction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:5
verses.text: For here he shows two things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:6
verses.text: First, that the thing is so necessary, as not to require instruction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:7
verses.text: For things that are very important are manifest to all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:8
verses.text: And secondly, by saying this he makes them more ashamed than if he had admonished them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:9
verses.text: For he who thinks that they have behaved aright, and therefore does not admonish them, even if they had not behaved aright, would the sooner lead them to it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:10
verses.text: And observe, he does not speak of love towards all, but of that towards the brethren.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:11
verses.text: "We have no need to write unto you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:12
verses.text: He ought then to have been silent, and to say nothing, if there was no need.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:13
verses.text: But now by saying there is no need, he has done a greater thing, than if he had said it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:14
verses.text: "For ye yourselves are taught of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:15
verses.text: And see with how high a praise he has made God their Teacher in this matter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:16
verses.text: Ye need not, he says, to learn from man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:17
verses.text: Which also the prophet says, "and they shall all be taught of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:18
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:19
verses.text: liv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:20
verses.text: ) "For ye yourselves," he says, "are taught of God to love one another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:21
verses.text: For indeed ye do it toward all the brethren, and those which are in all Macedonia"; and toward all the others, he means.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:22
verses.text: These words are very encouraging to make them do so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:23
verses.text: And I do not merely say, that ye are taught of God, but I know it from the things which you do.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:24
verses.text: And in this respect he bore many testimonies to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:25
verses.text: "But we exhort you, brethren, that ye abound more and more, and study;" that is, increase and study.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:26
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:28
verses.text: "To be quiet, and to do your own business, and to work with your hands, even as we charged you: that ye may walk honestly toward them that are without, and may have need of nothing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:29
verses.text: He shows of how many evils idleness is the cause, and of how many benefits industry.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:30
verses.text: And this he makes manifest from things which happen among us, as he often does, and that wisely.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:31
verses.text: For by these things the majority are led on more than by spiritual things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:32
verses.text: For it is a mark of love to our neighbors not to receive from them, but to impart to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:33
verses.text: And observe.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:34
verses.text: Being about to exhort and admonish, he places in the middle their good conduct, both that they may recover even from the preceding admonition, and from the threat, when he said, "He therefore that rejecteth, rejecteth not man, but God," and that they may not be restive at this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:35
verses.text: And this is the effect of working, that one does not receive of others, nor live idly, but by working imparts to others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:36
verses.text: For it is said, "It is more blessed to give than to receive".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:37
verses.text: (Acts xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:38
verses.text: ) "And to work," he says, "with your hands".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:39
verses.text: Where are those, who look out for work that is spiritual? Seest thou how he takes from them every excuse, saying, "with your hands"? But does one practice fasting with his hands? or watchings all night? or lyings on the ground? This no one can say.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:40
verses.text: But he is speaking of spiritual work.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:41
verses.text: For it is truly spiritual, that one should by working impart to others, and there is nothing equal to this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:42
verses.text: "That ye may walk," he says, "becomingly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:43
verses.text: Seest thou whence he touches them? He has not said, that ye may not be shamed by begging.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:44
verses.text: But he has indeed insinuated the same, yet he puts it in a milder way, so as both to strike and not to do this severely.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:45
verses.text: For if those who are among us are offended at these things, much more those who are without, finding numberless accusations and handles, when they see a man who is in good health and able to support himself, begging and asking help of others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:46
verses.text: Wherefore also they call us Christ-mongers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:47
verses.text: On this account, he means, "the name of God is blasphemed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:48
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:49
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:50
verses.text: ) But none of these things has he stated; but that which was able to touch them most nearly, the disgracefulness of the thing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:51
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:52
verses.text: "But we would not have you ignorant, brethren, concerning them that are asleep; that ye sorrow not, even as the rest, which have no hope".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:53
verses.text: These two things, poverty and despondency, distressed them most, which also pertain to all men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:54
verses.text: See therefore how he remedies them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:55
verses.text: But their poverty arose from their goods being taken from them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:56
verses.text: But if he commands those, whose goods had been taken from them for Christ's sake, to support themselves by working, much more then others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:57
verses.text: For that they were taken away is manifest from his saying, Ye became partakers with the churches of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:58
verses.text: How partakers with them? "And ye took joyfully the spoiling of your possessions".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:59
verses.text: (Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:60
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:61
verses.text: )  Here he proceeds now to start his discourse concerning the Resurrection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:62
verses.text: And why? Had he not discoursed with them upon that point? Yes, but here he glances at some further mystery.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:63
verses.text: What then is this? "That we that are alive," he says, "that are left unto the coming of the Lord, shall in nowise precede them that are fallen asleep".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:64
verses.text: The discourse then of the Resurrection was sufficient to comfort him that was grieving.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:65
verses.text: But that which is now said is sufficient also to make the Resurrection eminently worthy of credit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:66
verses.text: But first let us speak of what precedes, "But we would not have you ignorant, brethren, concerning them that are asleep; that ye sorrow not, even as the rest, which have no hope".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:67
verses.text: See how here also he treats them mildly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:68
verses.text: He does not say, "Are ye so without understanding?" as he said to the Corinthians, "foolish"? that, knowing there is a resurrection, ye so sorrow, as those who do not believe; but he speaks very mildly, showing respect to their other virtues.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:69
verses.text: And he has not said "concerning the dead," but "them that are asleep," even at the beginning suggesting consolation to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:70
verses.text: "That ye sorrow not," he says, "even as the rest, which have no hope".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:71
verses.text: Therefore to afflict yourselves for the departed is to act like those who have no hope.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:72
verses.text: And they justly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:73
verses.text: For a soul that knows nothing of the Resurrection, but thinks that this death is death, naturally afflicts itself, and bewails and mourns intolerably as for lost ones.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:74
verses.text: But thou, who expectest a resurrection, on what account dost thou lament? To lament then is the part of those who have no hope.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:75
verses.text: Hear this, ye women, as many of you as are fond of wailing, as many as at times of mourning take the sorrow impatiently, that ye act the part of heathens.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:76
verses.text: But if to grieve for the departed is the part of heathens, then tell me whose part it is to beat one's self, and tear the cheeks? On what account do you lament, if you believe that he will rise again, that he has not perished, that the matter is but a slumber and a sleep? You say, On account of his society, his protection, his care of our affairs, and all his other services.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:77
verses.text: When therefore you lose a child at an untimely age, who is not yet able to do anything, on what account do you lament? Why do you seek to recall him? He was displaying, you say, good hopes, and I was expecting that he would be my supporter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:78
verses.text: On this account I miss my husband, on this account my son, on this account I wail and lament, not disbelieving the Resurrection, but being left destitute of support, and having lost my protector, my companion, who shared with me in all things—my comforter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:79
verses.text: On this account I mourn.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:80
verses.text: I know that he will rise again, but I cannot bear the intermediate separation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:81
verses.text: A multitude of troubles rushes in upon me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:82
verses.text: I am exposed to all who are willing to injure me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:83
verses.text: Those of my servants who formerly feared me now despise me, and trample upon me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:84
verses.text: If any one has been benefited, he has forgotten the benefit he received from him; if any one was ill-treated by the departed, to return the grudge against him, he lets loose his anger upon me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:85
verses.text: These things do not suffer me to bear my widowhood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:86
verses.text: It is for these things that I afflict myself, for these things I bewail.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:87
verses.text: How then shall we comfort such? What shall we say? How shall we banish their sorrow? In the first place I shall endeavor to convict them, that their wailing proceeds not from these things they say, but from an unreasonable passion.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:88
verses.text: For if you mourn for these things, you ought always to mourn the departed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:89
verses.text: But if when a year has passed away, you forget him as if he had never been, you do not bewail the departed nor his protection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:90
verses.text: But you cannot endure the separation, nor the breaking off of your society? And what can they say, who even enter into second marriages? Sure enough! It is the former husbands that they long for.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:91
verses.text: But let us not direct our discourse to them, but to those who preserve a kind affection towards the departed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:92
verses.text: Wherefore dost thou lament thy child? Wherefore thine husband? The former, because I had not enjoyed him, you say; the latter, because I expected that I should have enjoyed him longer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:93
verses.text: And this very thing, what want of faith does it argue, to suppose that thy husband or thy son constitutes thy safety, and not God! How dost thou not think to provoke Him? For often on this account He takes them away, that thou mayest not be so bound to them, so that it may withdraw thy hopes from them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:94
verses.text: For God is jealous, and wills to be loved by us most of all things: and that, because He loves us exceedingly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:95
verses.text: For ye know that this is the custom of those who love to distraction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:96
verses.text: They are excessively jealous, and would choose rather to throw away their life, than to be surpassed in esteem by any of their rival lovers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:97
verses.text: On this account also God hath taken him because of these words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:98
verses.text: For, tell me, on what account were there not in old times widowhoods, and untimely orphanhoods? Wherefore did He permit Abraham and Isaac to live a long time? Because even when he was living he preferred God before him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:99
verses.text: He said indeed, slay; and he slew him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:100
verses.text: Why did he bring Sarah to so great an age? Because, even whilst she was living, he listened to God rather than to her.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:101
verses.text: For this reason God said to him, "Hear Sarah thy wife".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:102
verses.text: (From Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:103
verses.text: xxi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:104
verses.text: ) No one then either from love to husband or wife, or on account of the protection of a child, provoked God to anger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:105
verses.text: But now because we are declining downwards, and have exceedingly fallen off, we men love our wives more than God, and we women honor our husbands more than God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:106
verses.text: It is on this account that He draws us even against our will to the love of Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:107
verses.text: Love not thy husband more than God, and thou shalt not ever experience widowhood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:108
verses.text: Or rather, even if it should happen, thou shalt not have the feeling of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:109
verses.text: Why? Because thou hast an immortal Protector who loves thee better.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:110
verses.text: If thou lovest God more, mourn not: for He who is more beloved is immortal, and does not suffer thee to feel the loss of him who is less beloved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:111
verses.text: This I will make manifest to thee by an example.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:112
verses.text: Tell me, if thou hast a husband, complying with thee in all things, one that is respected, and that makes thee honorable everywhere, and not to be despised, one respected amongst all, intelligent and wise, and loving thee, thou being esteemed happy on his account, and in conjunction with him shouldest thou also bring forth a child, and then before it has arrived at the age of maturity, that child should depart; wilt thou then feel the affliction? By no means.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:113
verses.text: For he that is more beloved makes it disappear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:114
verses.text: And now if thou love God more than thy husband, assuredly He will not soon take him away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:115
verses.text: But even if He should take him, thou wilt not be sensible of the affliction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:116
verses.text: For this reason the blessed Job felt no severe suffering, when he heard of the death of his children all at once, because he loved God more than them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:117
verses.text: And whilst He whom he loved was living, those things would not be able to afflict him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:118
verses.text: What sayest thou, O woman? Thy husband or thy son was thy protector? But does not thy God spare thee? Who gave thee thy very husband? Was it not He? And who made thee? Was it not He? He surely who brought thee out of nothing into being, and breathed into thee a soul, and put in thee a mind, and vouchsafed to favor thee with the knowledge of Himself, and for thy sake spared not His only-begotten Son, does not He spare thee? And does thy fellow-servant spare thee? What wrath is due to these words! What of this kind hast thou had from thy husband? Thou canst not say anything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:119
verses.text: For if he has even done thee any kindness, it was after he had received kindness, you having previously begun.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:120
verses.text: But in the case of God no one can say any such thing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:121
verses.text: For it is not as having received any favors from us that God benefits us, but being incapable of want, from His goodness alone He does good to mankind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:122
verses.text: He has promised thee a kingdom, He has given immortal life, glory, brotherhood, adoption.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:123
verses.text: He has made thee fellow-heir with His Only-Begotten.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:124
verses.text: And dost thou after so great benefits remember thy husband? What has he bestowed of this kind? He has made His sun to shine, He has given rain, He sustains thee with yearly nourishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:125
verses.text: Woe to us for our great ingratitude!  For this reason He takes thy husband, that thou mayest not seek him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:126
verses.text: But dost thou still cling to him though departed, and forsakest God, when it was thy duty to give thanks, to cast it all upon Him? For what is it that thou hast received from thy husband? The pains of childbirth, and labors, and insults and reproaches often, and chidings, and bursts of anger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:127
verses.text: Are not these the things that come from husbands? But there are, you say, other things too that are good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:128
verses.text: Of what sort then are these? Did he set off thy beauty with costly garments? Did he put gold ornaments about thy face? Did he make thee respected by all? But if thou wilt, thou shalt adorn thyself with a much better ornament than the departed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:129
verses.text: For gravity makes its possessor much more admirable than golden ornaments.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:130
verses.text: This King also has garments, not of this sort, but much better.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:131
verses.text: With those, if thou wilt, invest thyself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:132
verses.text: Of what sort then are they? There is a clothing which has fringes of gold; if thou wilt, array the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:133
verses.text: But did he make thee not to be despised by men? And what is there great in that? Thy widowhood suffers thee not to be despised by the demons.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:134
verses.text: Then thou ruledst over thy servants, if at least thou didst at all rule over them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:135
verses.text: But now, instead of thy servants, thou hast mastery over unbodied powers, principalities, authorities, the ruler of this world.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:136
verses.text: And thou dost not mention the troubles, in which thou sharedst with him, sometimes the fear of magistrates, sometimes the preference given to neighbors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:137
verses.text: From all these things thou art now delivered, from dread and fear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:138
verses.text: But art thou solicitous who will support the children that are left thee? The "Father of the fatherless".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:139
verses.text: For tell me, who gave them? Dost thou not hear Christ in the Gospels saying, "Is not the life more than the food, and the body than the raiment?" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:140
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:141
verses.text: )  Seest thou, that thy lamentation is not from loss of his society, but from want of faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:142
verses.text: But the children of a father that is dead are not equally illustrious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:143
verses.text: Wherefore? They have God for their Father, and are they not illustrious? How many can I show you brought up by widows, who have become famous, how many who have been under their fathers, and have been undone! For if thou bringest them up from their first youth, as they ought to be brought up, they will enjoy an advantage much greater than a father's protection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:144
verses.text: For that it is the business of widows—I speak of the bringing up of children—hear Paul saying, "If she hath brought up children" ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:145
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:146
verses.text: ); and again, "She shall be saved through the child-bearing," (he has not said through her husband,) if they continue in faith and love and sanctification with sobriety".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:147
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:148
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:149
verses.text: ) Instill into them the fear of God from their first youth, and He will protect them better than any father; this will be a wall not to be broken.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:150
verses.text: For when there is a guard seated within, we have no need of contrivances without: but where he is not, all our outward contrivances are vain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:151
verses.text: This will be to them wealth and glory too and ornament.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:152
verses.text: This will make them illustrious, not upon earth, but even in heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:153
verses.text: For do not look to those who are begirt with the golden girdles, nor those who are borne on horses, nor those who shine in kings' palaces on account of their fathers, nor those who have footmen and tutors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:154
verses.text: For these things perhaps cause widows to bewail over their orphans, thinking that this my son also, if his father at least were living, would have enjoyed so much happiness; but now he is in a state of depression and dishonor, and worthy of no consideration.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:155
verses.text: Think not of these things, O woman, but open to thee in thought the gates of heaven, consider the palace there, behold the King who is there seated.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:156
verses.text: Consider if those who are upon the earth can be more illustrious than thy son there—and then groan.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:157
verses.text: But if some are of good repute on earth, this is not worth any consideration.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:158
verses.text: It is allowed him, if thou wilt, to be a soldier in heaven, to enlist him in the ranks of that army.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:159
verses.text: For those who are enlisted there are not borne on horses, but in the clouds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:160
verses.text: They walk not upon earth, but are caught up into heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:161
verses.text: They have not slaves to go before them, but the Angels themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:162
verses.text: They stand not in the presence of a mortal king, but of Him who is immortal, the King of kings and Lord of lords.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:163
verses.text: They have not a leathern girdle about their loins, but that glory which is unspeakable, and they are more splendid than kings, or whoever have been most illustrious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:164
verses.text: For in those royal courts not wealth is required, nor noble birth, nothing else than virtue alone; and where that is present, nothing is wanting to their obtaining the chief place.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:165
verses.text: Nothing is painful to us, if we are willing to cultivate wisdom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:166
verses.text: Look up to heaven, and see how much more splendid it is than the roofs of palaces.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:167
verses.text: And if the pavement of the palaces above is so much more grand than those below, that the one may be considered as dirt in comparison with the other; if any one should be thought worthy to see those palaces perfectly, what blessedness will not be his!  "But she," he says, "that is a widow indeed, and desolate, hath her hope set on God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:168
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:169
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:170
verses.text: ) To whom is this said? To those who have no children, because they are more highly approved, and have a greater opportunity of pleasing God, because all their chains are loosened to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:171
verses.text: There is no one to hold them fast, no one to compel them to drag their chains after them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:172
verses.text: Thou art separated from thy husband, but art united to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:173
verses.text: Thou hast not a fellow-servant for thy associate, but thou hast thy Lord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:174
verses.text: When thou prayest, tell me, dost thou not converse with God? When thou readest, hear Him conversing with thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:175
verses.text: And what does He say to thee? Much kinder words than thy husband.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:176
verses.text: For though indeed thy husband should flatter thee, the honor is not great, for he is thy fellow-servant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:177
verses.text: But when the Lord flatters the slave, then is the courtship great.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:178
verses.text: How then does He court us? Hear by what means he does it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:179
verses.text: "Come," He says, "unto Me, all ye that labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:180
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:181
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:182
verses.text: ) And again through the Prophet He calls, saying, "Will a woman forget to have compassion on the offspring of her womb? But even if a woman should forget, yet will I not forget thee, saith the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:183
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:184
verses.text: xlix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:185
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:186
verses.text: ) Of how great a love are these words? And again, "Turn unto Me" (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:187
verses.text: xlv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:188
verses.text: ); and again elsewhere, "Turn unto Me, and thou shalt be saved".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:189
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:190
verses.text: xliv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:191
verses.text: ) And if one was willing to select too from the Canticles, taking them in the more mystical way, he will hear Him conversing and saying to every soul that is fitted for Him, "My fair one, my dove".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:192
verses.text: (Cant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:193
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 7:194
verses.text: ) What is sweeter than these words? Seest thou the conversation of God with men? But what? tell me, seest thou not how many children of those blessed women are gone, and are in their tombs; how many have suffered more severely, and with their husbands have lost also their children? To these things let us attend; let us be anxious about these things, and nothing will be grievous to us, but we shall continue passing all our time in spiritual joy; and we shall enjoy the eternal blessings, of which may we all be partakers, by the grace and lovingkindness, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:1
verses.text: Homily VII.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:2
verses.text: Thessalonians iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:3
verses.text: "But we would not have you ignorant, brethren, concerning them that are asleep; that ye sorrow not, even as the rest, which have no hope".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:4
verses.text: There are many things which from ignorance alone cause us sorrow, so that if we come to understand them well, we banish our grief.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:5
verses.text: This therefore Paul also showing, says, "I would not have you ignorant, that ye sorrow not, even as the rest, which have no hope".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:6
verses.text: Is it on this account thou wouldest not have them ignorant? But wherefore dost thou not speak of the punishment that is laid up? Ignorant, says he, of the doctrine of the Resurrection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:7
verses.text: But why? This is manifest from the other, and is admitted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:8
verses.text: But meanwhile, together with that, there will also be this not inconsiderable gain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:9
verses.text: For since they did not disbelieve the Resurrection, but nevertheless bewailed, on this account he speaks.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:10
verses.text: And he discourses indeed with those who disbelieve the Resurrection in one way, but with these in another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:11
verses.text: For it is manifest that they knew, who were enquiring about the "times and seasons".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:12
verses.text: ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:13
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:14
verses.text: )  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:15
verses.text: "For if we believe," he says, "that Jesus died and rose again," and lived, "even so them also that are fallen asleep in Jesus will God bring with Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:16
verses.text: Where are they who deny the Flesh? For if He did not assume Flesh, neither did He die.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:17
verses.text: If He did not die, neither did He rise again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:18
verses.text: How then does he exhort us from these things to faith? Was he not then according to them a trifler and a deceiver? For if to die proceeds from sin, and Christ did not sin, how does he now encourage us? And now, concerning whom does he say, O men, for whom do ye mourn? For whom do ye sorrow? for sinners, or simply for those who die? And why does he say, "Even as the rest, which have no hope"? For whom do the rest mourn? so that to them all these things are vapid.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:19
verses.text: "The firstborn from the dead" (Col.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:20
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:21
verses.text: ), he says, the first-fruits.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:22
verses.text: Therefore there must also be others left.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:23
verses.text: And see how here he introduces nothing from reasonings, because they were docile.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:24
verses.text: For in writing to the Corinthians, he started many things also from reasonings, and then he added, "Thou fool, that which thou sowest is not quickened".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:25
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:26
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:27
verses.text: ) For this is more authoritative, but it is when he converses with the believer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:28
verses.text: But with him who is without, what authority would this have? "Even so," he says, "them also that are fallen asleep in Jesus will God bring with Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:29
verses.text: Again, "fallen asleep": he nowhere says, the dead.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:30
verses.text: But with respect to Christ, his words are, "He died," because there followed mention of the Resurrection, but here "them that are fallen asleep".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:31
verses.text: How "through Jesus"? Either that they fell asleep through Jesus, or that through Jesus will He bring them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:32
verses.text: The phrase "that fell asleep through Jesus" means the faithful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:33
verses.text: Here the heretics say, that he is speaking of the baptized.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:34
verses.text: What place then is there for "even so"? For Jesus did not fall asleep through Baptism.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:35
verses.text: But on what account does he say, "them that are fallen asleep"? So that he is discoursing not of a general Resurrection, but of a partial one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:36
verses.text: Them that are fallen asleep through Jesus, he says, and thus he speaks in many places.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:37
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:38
verses.text: "For this we say unto you by the word of the Lord, that we that are alive, that are left unto the coming of the Lord, shall in nowise precede them that are fallen asleep".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:39
verses.text: Speaking concerning the faithful, and them "which are fallen asleep in Christ" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:40
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:41
verses.text: ); and again, "the dead shall rise in Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:42
verses.text: Since his discourse is not concerning the Resurrection only, but both concerning the Resurrection and concerning the honor in glory; all then shall partake of a Resurrection, he says, but not all shall be in glory, only those in Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:43
verses.text: Since therefore he wishes to comfort them, he comforts them not with this only, but also with the abundant honor, and with its speedy arrival, since they knew that.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:44
verses.text: For in proof that he wishes to comfort them with the honor, as he goes on, he says, "And we shall be ever with the Lord": and "we shall be caught up in the clouds".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:45
verses.text: But how do the faithful fall asleep in Jesus? It means having Christ within themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:46
verses.text: But the expression, "He shall bring with Him," shows that they are brought from many places.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:47
verses.text: "This".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:48
verses.text: Something strange he was about to tell them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:49
verses.text: On this account he also adds what makes it worthy of credit; "From the word of the Lord," he says, that is, we speak not of ourselves, but having learnt from Christ, "That we that are alive, that are left unto the coming of the Lord, shall in nowise precede them that are fallen asleep".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:50
verses.text: Which also he says in his Epistle to the Corinthians; "In a moment, in the twinkling of an eye".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:51
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:52
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:53
verses.text: ) Here he gives a credibility to the Resurrection by the manner also in which it will occur.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:54
verses.text: For because the matter seems to be difficult he says that as it is easy for the living to be taken up, so also for the departed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:55
verses.text: But in saying "we," he does not speak of himself, for he was not about to remain until the Resurrection, but he speaks of the faithful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:56
verses.text: On this account he has added, "We that are left unto the coming of the Lord shall in nowise precede them that are fallen asleep".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:57
verses.text: As if he had said, Think not that there is any difficulty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:58
verses.text: It is God that does it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:59
verses.text: They who are then alive shall not anticipate those who are dissolved, who are rotted, who have been dead ten thousand years.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:60
verses.text: But as it is easy to bring those who are entire, so is it also those who are dissolved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:61
verses.text: But there are some who disbelieve the matter, because they know not God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:62
verses.text: For, tell me, which is the more easy, to bring one into being out of nothing, or to raise up again him that was dissolved? But what say they? A certain one suffered shipwreck and was drowned in the sea, and having fallen many fishes caught him, and each of the fish devoured some member.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:63
verses.text: Then of these very fishes, one was caught in this gulf, and one in that, and this was eaten by one man, and that by another, while having in it the devoured pieces of flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:64
verses.text: And again, those who ate the fishes, that had eaten up the man, died in different places, and were themselves perhaps devoured by wild beasts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:65
verses.text: And—when there has been so great a confusion and dispersion—how shall the man rise again? Who shall gather up the dust? But wherefore dost thou say this, O man, and weavest strings of trifles, and makest it a matter of perplexity? For tell me, if the man had not fallen into the sea, if the fish had not eaten him, nor the fish again been devoured by numberless men—but he had been preserved with care in a coffin, and neither worms nor anything else had disturbed him, how shall that which is dissolved rise again? How shall the dust and ashes be again conglutinated? Whence shall there be any more its bloom for the body? But is not this a difficulty?  If indeed they be Greeks who raise these doubts, we shall have numberless things to say to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:66
verses.text: What then? For there are among them those who convey souls into plants, and shrubs, and dogs.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:67
