verses.text: Tell me, which is more easy, to resume one's own body, or that of another? Others again say that they are consumed by fire, and that there is a resurrection of garments and of shoes, and they are not ridiculed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:68
verses.text: Others say atoms.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:69
verses.text: With them, however, we have no argument at all; but to the faithful, (if we ought to call them faithful who raise questions,) we will still say what the Apostle has said, that all life springs from corruption, all plants, all seeds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:70
verses.text: Seest thou not the fig tree, what a trunk it has, what stems, how many leaves, and branches, stalks, and roots, occupying so much ground and embosomed therein.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:71
verses.text: This then, such and so great as it is, springs from the grain which was thrown into the ground and itself first corrupted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:72
verses.text: And if it be not rotted and dissolved, there will be none of these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:73
verses.text: Tell me, whence does this happen? And the vine too, which is so fair both to see and to partake of, springs from that which is vile in appearance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:74
verses.text: And what, tell me, is not the water that descends from above one thing? how is it changed into so many things? For this is more wonderful than the Resurrection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:75
verses.text: For there indeed the same seed and the same plant is the subject, and there is a great affinity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:76
verses.text: But here tell me how, having one quality and one nature, it turns into so many things? In the vine it becomes wine, and not only wine, but leaves and sap.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:77
verses.text: For not only is the cluster of grapes, but the rest of the vine nourished by it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:78
verses.text: Again, in the olive (it becomes) oil, and the other so numerous things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:79
verses.text: And what is wonderful, here it is moist, there dry, here sweet there sour, here astringent, elsewhere bitter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:80
verses.text: Tell me how it turns into so many things? Show me the reason! But you cannot.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:81
verses.text: And in the case of thyself, tell me, for this comes nearer, this seed, that is deposited, how is it fashioned and molded into so many things? how into eyes? how into ears? how into hands? how into heart? Are there not in the body ten thousand differences of figures, of sizes, of qualities, of positions, of powers, of proportions? Nerves and veins and flesh and bones and membranes, and arteries and joints and cartilages, and as many more things beside these, as the sons of the physicians precisely specify, which compose our nature—and these come from that one seed! Does not this then seem to you much more difficult than those things? How is the moist and soft congealed into the dry and cold, that is, bone? How into the warm and moist, which are united in the blood? How into the cold and soft, the nerve? How into the cold and moist, the artery? Tell me, whence are these things? Art thou not quite at a loss about these things? Dost thou not see every day a resurrection and a death taking place in the periods of our life? Whither is our youth gone? whence is our age come? how is it that he who is grown old cannot indeed make himself young, but begets another, a very young child, and what he cannot give to himself, that he bestows upon another?  This also we may see in trees and in animals.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:82
verses.text: And yet that which gives to another ought first to bestow upon itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:83
verses.text: But this is what human reasoning demands.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:84
verses.text: But when God creates, let all things give way.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:85
verses.text: If these things are so difficult, nay, so excessively difficult, I am reminded of those mad persons, who are curious about the incorporeal Generation of the Son.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:86
verses.text: Things that take place every day, that are within the grasp of our hands, and that have been enquired into ten thousand times, no one has yet been able to discover; tell me, then, how is it they are curious about that secret and ineffable Generation? Is not the mind of such men wearied in treading that void? Has it not been whirled into ten thousand giddinesses? Is it not dumfounded? And yet not even so are they instructed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:87
verses.text: When they are able to say nothing about grapes and figs, they are curious about God! For tell me, how is that grape-stone resolved into leaves and stems? How before this were they not in it, nor seen in it? But it is not the grape-stone, you say, but all is from the earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:88
verses.text: Then how is it that without this the earth bears nothing of itself? But let us not be void of understanding.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:89
verses.text: What takes place is neither from the earth, nor from the grape-stone, but from Him who is Lord both of the earth and of its seeds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:90
verses.text: For this reason He has caused the same thing to be made both without them, and with them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:91
verses.text: In the first place, showing His own power, when he said, "Let the earth bring forth the herb of grass".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:92
verses.text: (From Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:93
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:94
verses.text: ) And secondly, besides showing His power, instructing us also to be laborious and industrious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:95
verses.text: Why then have these things been said by us? Not idly, but that we may believe also in the Resurrection, and that, when we again wish to apprehend something by our reasonings, but do not find it, we may not be angry and take offense, but discreetly withdrawing and checking our reasoning, we may take refuge in the power and skillfulness of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:96
verses.text: Knowing these things therefore, let us put a curb upon our reasonings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:97
verses.text: Let us not transgress our bounds, nor the measures that have been assigned to our knowledge.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:98
verses.text: For, "If any man," he says, "thinketh that he knoweth anything, he knoweth nothing yet as he ought to know".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:99
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:100
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:101
verses.text: )  I speak not concerning God, he says, but concerning everything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:102
verses.text: For what? wouldest thou learn about the earth? What dost thou know? Tell me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:103
verses.text: How great is its measure? What is its size? What is its manner of position? What is its essence? What is its place? Where does it stand, and upon what? None of these things can you tell? But that it is cold, and dry, and black, this you can tell—and nothing farther.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:104
verses.text: Again, concerning the sea? But there you will be reduced to the same uncertainty, not knowing where it begins, and where it ends, and upon what it is borne, what supports the bottom of it, and what sort of place there is for it, and whether after it there is a continent, or it ends in water and air.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:105
verses.text: And what dost thou know of the things that are in it? But what? Let me pass over the elements.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:106
verses.text: Would you have us select the smallest of plants? The unfruitful grass, a thing which we all know, tell me, how it is brought forth? Is not the material of it water, and earth, and dung? What is it that makes it appear so beautiful, and have such an admirable color? Whence does that beauty so fade away? This is not the work of water, or of earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:107
verses.text: Seest thou that there is everywhere need of faith? How does the earth bring forth, how does it travail? Tell me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:108
verses.text: But you can tell me none of these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:109
verses.text: Be instructed, O man, in things that are here below, and be not curious nor overmeddling about heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:110
verses.text: And would it were heaven, and not the Lord of heaven! Dost thou not know the earth from which thou wast brought forth, in which thou wast nourished, which thou inhabitest, on which thou walkest, without which thou canst not even breathe; and art thou curious about things so far removed? Truly "man is vanity".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:111
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:112
verses.text: xxxix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:113
verses.text: , and cxliv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:114
verses.text: ) And if any one should bid thee descend into the deep, and trace out things at the bottom of the sea, thou wouldest not tolerate the command.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:115
verses.text: But, when no one compels thee, thou art willing of thyself to fathom the unsearchable abyss? Do not so, I beseech you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:116
verses.text: But let us sail upwards, not floating, for we shall soon be weary, and sink; but using the divine Scriptures, as some vessel, let us unfurl the sails of faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:117
verses.text: If we sail in them, then the Word of God will be present with us as our Pilot.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:118
verses.text: But if we float upon human reasonings, it will not be so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:119
verses.text: For to whom of those who float, is a Pilot present? So that the danger is twofold, in that there is no vessel, and that the Pilot is absent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:120
verses.text: For if even the boat without a pilot is unsafe, when both are wanting, what hope is there of safety? Let us not then throw ourselves into manifest danger, but let us go upon a safe vessel, having fastened ourselves by the sacred anchor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 8:121
verses.text: For thus we shall sail into the tranquil haven, with much merchandise, and at the same time with great safety, and we shall obtain the blessings laid up for them that love Him, in Christ Jesus our Lord, with whom, to the Father, together with the Holy Spirit, be glory, power, honor, now and always and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:1
verses.text: Homily VIII.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:2
verses.text: Thessalonians iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:3
verses.text: –  "For this we say unto you by the word of the Lord, that we that are alive, that are left unto the coming of the Lord, shall in nowise precede them that are fallen asleep.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:4
verses.text: For the Lord Himself shall descend from heaven, with a shout, with the voice of the Archangel, and with the trump of God: and the dead in Christ shall rise first: then we that are alive, that are left, shall together with them be caught up in the clouds, to meet the Lord in the air: and so shall we ever be with the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:5
verses.text: The Prophets indeed, wishing to show the credibility of the things said by them, before all other things say this, "The vision which Isaiah saw" (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:6
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:7
verses.text: ); and again, "The word of the Lord which came to Jeremiah" (Jer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:8
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:9
verses.text: , Sept); and again, "Thus saith the Lord"; with many such expressions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:10
verses.text: And many of them even saw God sitting, as far as it was possible for them to see Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:11
verses.text: But Paul not having seen Him sitting, but having Christ speaking in himself, instead of Thus saith the Lord, said, "Do ye seek a proof of Christ speaking in me?" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:12
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:13
verses.text: ) And again, "Paul, an Apostle of Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:14
verses.text: For the "Apostle" speaks the things of Him who sent him; showing that nothing is of himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:15
verses.text: And again, "I think that I also have the Spirit of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:16
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:17
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:18
verses.text: ) All those things therefore he spake by the Spirit, but this, which he now says, he heard even expressly from God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:19
verses.text: As also that which he had said discoursing to the Elders of Ephesus, "It is more blessed to give than to receive," he heard among things not recorded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:20
verses.text: (Acts xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:21
verses.text: )  Let us then see what he now also says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:22
verses.text: "For this we say unto you by the word of the Lord, that we that are alive, that are left unto the coming of the Lord, shall in nowise precede them that are fallen asleep.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:23
verses.text: For the Lord Himself shall descend from heaven, with a shout, with the voice of the Archangel, and with the last trump".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:24
verses.text: For then, he saith, "The powers of the heavens shall be shaken".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:25
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:26
verses.text: xxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:27
verses.text: ) But wherefore with the trumpet? For we see this on Mount Sinai too, and Angels there also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:28
verses.text: But what means the voice of the Archangel? As he said in the parable of the Virgins, Arise! "The Bridegroom cometh".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:29
verses.text: (From Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:30
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:31
verses.text: ) Either it means this, or that as in the case of a king, so also shall it then be, Angels ministering at the Resurrection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:32
verses.text: For He says, let the dead rise, and the work is done, the Angels not having power to do this, but His word.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:33
verses.text: As if upon a king's commanding and saying it, those who were shut up should go forth, and the servants should lead them out, yet they do this not from their own power, but from that Voice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:34
verses.text: This also Christ says in another place: "He shall send forth his Angels with a great trumpet, and they shall gather together his Elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:35
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:36
verses.text: xxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:37
verses.text: ) And everywhere you see the Angels running to and fro.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:38
verses.text: The Archangel therefore I think is he, who is set over those who are sent forth, and who shouts thus: "Make all men ready, for the Judge is at hand".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:39
verses.text: And what is "at the last trumpet"? Here he implies that there are many trumpets, and that at the last the Judge descends.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:40
verses.text: "And the dead," he says, "in Christ shall rise first.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:41
verses.text: Then we that are alive, that are left, shall together with them be caught up in the clouds, to meet the Lord in the air: and so shall we ever be with the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:42
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:43
verses.text: "Wherefore comfort one another with these words".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:44
verses.text: If He is about to descend, on what account shall we be caught up? For the sake of honor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:45
verses.text: For when a king drives into a city, those who are in honor go out to meet him; but the condemned await the judge within.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:46
verses.text: And upon the coming of an affectionate father, his children indeed, and those who are worthy to be his children, are taken out in a chariot, that they may see and kiss him; but those of the domestics who have offended remain within.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:47
verses.text: We are carried upon the chariot of our Father.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:48
verses.text: For He received Him up in the clouds, and "we shall be caught up in the clouds".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:49
verses.text: (Acts i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:50
verses.text: ) Seest thou how great is the honor? and as He descends, we go forth to meet Him, and, what is more blessed than all, so we shall be with Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:51
verses.text: "Who shall speak of the mightinesses of the Lord, and make all His praises to be heard?" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:52
verses.text: cvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:53
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:54
verses.text: ) How many blessings has He vouchsafed to the human race! Those who are dead are raised first, and thus the meeting takes place together.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:55
verses.text: Abel who died before all shall then meet Him together with those who are alive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:56
verses.text: So that they in this respect will have no advantage, but he who is corrupted, and has been so many years in the earth, shall meet Him with them, and so all the others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:57
verses.text: For if they awaited us, that we might be crowned, as elsewhere he says in an Epistle, "God having provided some better thing concerning us, that apart from us they should not be made perfect" (Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:58
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:59
verses.text: ), much more shall we also await them; or rather, they indeed awaited, but we not at all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:60
verses.text: For the Resurrection takes place "in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:61
verses.text: But as to the saying, that they are gathered together; they arise indeed everywhere, but are gathered together by the Angels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:62
verses.text: The former therefore is the work of the power of God commanding the earth to give up its deposit, and there is no one who ministers in it, as He then called Lazarus, "Lazarus, come forth" (John xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:63
verses.text: ); but the gathering is the work of ministers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:64
verses.text: But if Angels gather them together, and run to and fro, how are they caught up here? They are caught up after the descent, after that they are gathered together.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:65
verses.text: For this is also done without any one being aware.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:66
verses.text: For when they see the earth agitated, the dust mingling, the bodies rising perchance on every side, no one ministering to this, but the "shout" being sufficient, the whole earth filled (for consider how great a thing it is that all the men from Adam unto His coming shall then stand with wives and children),—when they see so great a tumult upon the earth,—then they shall know.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:67
verses.text: As therefore in the Dispensation that was in the Flesh, they had foreseen nothing of it, so also will it then be.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:68
verses.text: When these things then are done, then also will be the voice of the Archangel shouting and commanding the Angels, and the trumpets, or rather the sound of the trumpet.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:69
verses.text: What trembling then, what fear will possess those that remain upon the earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:70
verses.text: For one woman is caught up and another is left behind, and one man is taken, and another is passed over.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:71
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:72
verses.text: xxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:73
verses.text: , ; Luke xvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:75
verses.text: ) What will be the state of their souls, when they see some indeed taken up, but themselves left behind? Will not these things be able to shake their souls more terribly than any hell? Let us represent then in word that this is now present.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:76
verses.text: For if sudden death, or earthquakes in cities, and threatenings thus terrify our souls; when we see the earth breaking up, and crowded with all these, when we hear the trumpets, and the voice of the Archangel louder than any trumpet, when we perceive the heaven shriveled up, and God the King of all himself coming nigh—what then will be our souls? Let us shudder, I beseech you, and be frightened as if these things were now taking place.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:77
verses.text: Let us not comfort ourselves by the delay.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:78
verses.text: For when it must certainly happen, the delay profits us nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:79
verses.text: How great will then be the fear and trembling! Have you ever seen men led away to death? What do you think is the state of their souls, as they are going on the way to the gate? is it not worse than many deaths? What would they not choose both to do and to suffer, so that they might be delivered from that cloud of darkness? I have heard many say, who have been recalled by the mercy of the king (Emperor), after having been led away, that they did not even see men as men, their souls being so troubled, so horror-struck, and beside themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:80
verses.text: If then the death of the body thus frightens us, when eternal death approaches, what will be our feelings? And why do I speak of those who are led away? A crowd then stands around, the greater part not even knowing them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:81
verses.text: If any one looked into their souls, no one is so cruel, no one so hard-hearted, no one so firm, as not to have his soul dejected, and relaxed with fear and despair.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:82
verses.text: And if when others are taken off by this death, which differs nothing from sleep, those who are not concerned in it are thus affected; when we ourselves fall into greater evils, what then will be our state? It is not, believe me, it is not possible to represent the suffering by words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:83
verses.text: Nay, you say, but God is full of love to man, and none of these things will happen! Then it is written in vain! No, you say, but only as a threat, that we may become wise! If then we are not wise, but continue evil, will He not, tell me, inflict the punishment? Will He not then recompense the good either with rewards? Yes, you say, for that is becoming to Him, to do good even beyond desert.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:84
verses.text: So that those things indeed are true and will certainly be, while the punishments will not be at all, but are only for the purpose of a threat, and of terror! By what means I shall persuade you, I know not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:85
verses.text: If I say, that "the worm will not die, and the fire will not be quenched" (Mark ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:86
verses.text: ); if I say, that "they shall go away into everlasting fire" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:87
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:89
verses.text: ); if I set before you the rich man already suffering punishment, you will say that it is all a matter of threatening.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:90
verses.text: Whence then shall I persuade you? For this is a Satanic reasoning, indulging you with a favor that will not profit, and causing you to be slothful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:91
verses.text: How then can we banish it? Whatever things we say from Scripture, you will say, are for the purpose of threatening.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:92
verses.text: But with respect to future things this indeed might be said, but not so concerning things that have happened, and have had an end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:93
verses.text: You have heard of the deluge.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:94
verses.text: And were those things also said by way of threat? Did they not actually happen? Those men too said many such things, and for a hundred years while the ark was building, and the wood was being wrought, and the righteous man was calling aloud, there was no one who believed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:95
verses.text: But because they did not believe the threat in words, they suffered the punishment in very deed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:96
verses.text: And this will be our fate too, if we shall not have believed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:97
verses.text: On this account it is that He compares His coming with the days of Noah, because as some disbelieved in that deluge, so will they in the deluge of hell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:98
verses.text: Were these things a threat? were they not a fact? Then will not He, who then brought punishment upon them so suddenly, much more inflict it now also? For the things that are committed now are not less than the offenses of that time.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:99
verses.text: How?—because then, it says, "the sons of God went in unto the daughters of men" (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:100
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:101
verses.text: ), and those mixtures were the great offense.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:102
verses.text: But now there is no form of wickedness, which is unattempted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:103
verses.text: Do you then believe that the deluge took place? Or does it seem to you a fable? And yet even the mountains where the ark rested, bear witness; I speak of those in Armenia.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:104
verses.text: But, even superabundantly, I will turn my discourse to another thing more evident than that.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:105
verses.text: Has any one of you ever traveled in Palestine? For I will no longer mention report, but facts, and yet the other were clearer than facts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:106
verses.text: For whatever things the Scripture says, are more to be trusted than things we see.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:107
verses.text: Has any one of you then ever traveled in Palestine? I suppose so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:108
verses.text: What then? Bear witness then for me, ye who have seen the places, to those who have not been there.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:109
verses.text: For above Ascalon and Gaza up to the very end of the river Jordan there is a country wide and fruitful—or rather there was—for it is not now.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:110
verses.text: This then is that which was as a garden.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:111
verses.text: For it is said, "Lot beheld all the plain of Jordan—and it was well watered everywhere, like the garden of the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:112
verses.text: (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:113
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:114
verses.text: ) This, therefore, that was so flourishing, and that rivaled all countries, which for thrivingness exceeded the Paradise of God, is now more desolate than any wilderness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:115
verses.text: And there stand trees, indeed, and they bear fruit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:116
verses.text: But the fruit is a monument of the wrath of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:117
verses.text: For there stand pomegranates, I speak both of the tree and the fruit, having a very fine appearance, and to the ignorant man holding out great hopes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:118
verses.text: But if they are taken into the hand, being broken open they display no fruit indeed, but much dust and ashes stored up within.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:119
verses.text: Such also is the whole land.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:120
verses.text: If you find a stone, you will find it full of ashes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:121
verses.text: And why do I speak of stone and wood and earth, where the air and water partake of the calamity? For as when a body is burnt and consumed, the shape remains, and the outline in the appearance of the fire, and the bulk and the proportion, but the power is no more, so truly there you may see earth, which yet has nothing of earth about it, but all ashes; trees and fruit, but nothing of trees and fruit about them; air and water, but nothing of water nor of air about them, for even these are turned to ashes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:122
verses.text: And yet how could air ever have been burnt, or water, whilst it remained water? For wood and stones indeed it is possible to burn, but air and water it is altogether impossible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:123
verses.text: Impossible to us, but possible to Him who did these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:124
verses.text: Therefore the air is nothing else than a furnace, the water is a furnace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:125
verses.text: All things are unfruitful, all unproductive, all for vengeance; images of wrath that has gone before, and proofs of that which is to come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:126
verses.text: Are these too but threatening words? Are these but the sound of words? For to me indeed the former things were not incredible, but things not seen were equally credible with things that were seen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:127
verses.text: But even to the unbeliever these are sufficient to produce faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:128
verses.text: If any one disbelieves hell, let him consider Sodom, let him reflect upon Gomorrah, the vengeance that has been inflicted, and which yet remains.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:129
verses.text: This is a proof of the eternity of punishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:130
verses.text: Are these things grievous? And is it not grievous, when you say that there is no hell, but that God has merely threatened it? when you slack the hands of the people? It is thou who disbelievest that compellest me to say these things; it is thou that hast drawn me out into these words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:131
verses.text: If thou believedst the words of Christ I should not be compelled to bring forward facts to induce belief.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:132
verses.text: But since you have evaded them, you shall be persuaded henceforth, whether willing or unwilling.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:133
verses.text: For what have you to say concerning Sodom? Would you wish also to know the cause, for which these things were then done? It was one sin, a grievous and accursed one certainly, yet but one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:134
verses.text: The men of that time had a passion for boys, and on that account they suffered this punishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:135
verses.text: But now ten thousand sins equal and even more grievous than these are committed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:136
verses.text: Then He who for one sin poured forth so much anger, and neither regarded the supplication of Abraham, nor yet Lot who dwelt among them, the man who from honor to His servants offered his own daughters to insult, will He spare, when there are so many sins? These things truly are ridiculous, trifling, delusion, and diabolical deceit!  Do you wish that I should also bring forward another? You have certainly heard of Pharaoh, king of the Egyptians; you know therefore the punishment also which he suffered, how even with his whole host, chariots and horses and all, he was engulfed in the Erythraean sea.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:137
verses.text: Would you hear also other examples? he perhaps was an impious man, or rather not perhaps, but certainly he was an impious man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:138
verses.text: Would you see those also punished, who were of the number of believers, and who held fast to God, but were not of upright life? Hear Paul saying, "Neither let us commit fornication, as some of them committed, and fell in one day three and twenty thousand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:139
verses.text: Neither let us murmur, as some of them murmured, and perished by the destroyer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:140
verses.text: Neither let us tempt Christ, as some of them tempted, and perished by the serpents".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:141
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:142
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:144
verses.text: ) And if fornication, and if murmuring had such power, what will not be the effect of our sins?  And if thou dost not now pay the penalty, do not wonder.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:145
verses.text: For they knew not of a hell, therefore they were visited with punishments following close at their heels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:146
verses.text: But thou, whatever sins thou commit, though thou shouldest escape present penalty, wilt pay for it all There.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:147
verses.text: Did he so punish those who were nearly in the state of children, and who did not sin so greatly—and will He spare us? It would not be reasonable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:148
verses.text: For if we commit the same sins with them, we shall deserve a greater punishment than they did.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:149
verses.text: Wherefore? Because we have enjoyed more grace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:150
verses.text: But when our offenses are numerous, and more heinous than theirs, what vengeance shall we not undergo? They—and let no one think I say it as admiring them, or excusing them; far be it: for when God punishes, he who passes a contrary sentence, does it at the suggestion of the devil; I say this therefore, not praising them nor excusing them, but showing our wickedness—they therefore, although they murmured, were, however, traveling a wilderness road: but we murmur though we have a country, and are in our own houses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:151
verses.text: They, although they committed fornication, yet it was just after they came out of the evils of Egypt, and had hardly heard of such a law.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:152
verses.text: But we do it, having previously received from our forefathers the doctrine of salvation, so that we are deserving of greater punishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:153
verses.text: Would you hear also of other things? what were their sufferings in Palestine, famines, pestilences, wars, captivities, under the Babylonians, and under the Assyrians, and their miseries from the Macedonians, and those under Hadrian and Vespasian? I have something that I wish, beloved, to relate to thee; nay, do not run away! Or rather I will tell thee another thing before it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:154
verses.text: There was once a famine, it says, and the king was walking upon the wall; then a woman came to him and uttered these words: "O king, this woman said to me, Let us roast thy son to-day, and eat him—to-morrow mine.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:155
verses.text: And we roasted and ate, and now she does not give me hers".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:156
verses.text: (From  Kings vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:157
verses.text: ) What can be more dreadful than this calamity? Again, in another place the Prophet says, "The hands of the pitiful women have sodden their own children".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:158
verses.text: (Lam.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:159
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:160
verses.text: ) The Jews then suffered such punishment, and shall we not much rather suffer?  Would you also hear other calamities of theirs? Read over Josephus, and you will learn that whole tragedy, if perchance we may persuade you from these things, that there is a hell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:161
verses.text: For consider, if they were punished, why are we not punished? or how is it reasonable that we are not now punished, who sin more grievously than they? Is it not manifest that it is, because the punishment is kept in store for us? And, if you please, I will tell you in the person of every individual how they were punished.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:162
verses.text: Cain murdered his brother.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:163
verses.text: A horrible sin indeed, who can deny it? But he suffered punishment; and a heavy one, equivalent to ten thousand deaths, for he would rather have died ten thousand times.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:164
verses.text: For hear him saying, "If Thou castest me out from the land, and I shall be hidden from Thy face, then it will happen that every one who findeth me will slay me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:165
verses.text: (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:166
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:167
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:168
verses.text: ) Tell me then, do not many even now do the same things that he did? For when thou slayest not thy brother according to the flesh, but thy spiritual brother, dost thou not do the same? For what, though not by the sword? yet by some other means; when being able to relieve his hunger, thou neglectest him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:169
verses.text: What then? Has no one now envied his brother? has no one plunged him into dangers? But here they have not suffered punishment, yet they will suffer it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:170
verses.text: Then he, who never heard the written laws, nor the prophets, nor saw great miracles suffered such great vengeance; and shall he who has done the same things in another way, and was not rendered wise by so many examples, shall he go unpunished? Where then is the justice of God, and where His goodness?  Again, a certain one for having gathered sticks on the Sabbath was stoned, and yet this was a small commandment, and less weighty than circumcision.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:171
verses.text: He then who gathered sticks on the Sabbath was stoned; but those who often commit ten thousand things contrary to the Law have gone off unpunished! If then there be not a hell, where is His justice, where His impartiality, that respects not persons? And yet He lays to their charge many such things, that they did not observe the Sabbath.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:172
verses.text: Again, another, Charmi, having stolen a devoted thing, was stoned with all his family.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:173
verses.text: What then? Has no one from that time committed sacrilege? Saul, again, having spared contrary to the command of God, suffered so great punishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:174
verses.text: Has no one from that time spared? Would indeed that it were so! Have we not, worse than wild beasts, devoured one another contrary to the command of God, and yet no one has fallen in war? Again, the sons of Eli, because they ate before the incense was offered, suffered the most severe punishment together with their father.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:175
verses.text: Has no father then been neglectful with respect to his children? and are there no wicked sons? But no one has suffered punishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:176
verses.text: Where will they suffer it then, if there be no hell?  Again, numberless instances one might enumerate.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:177
verses.text: What? Ananias and Sapphira were immediately punished, because they stole part of what they had offered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:178
verses.text: Has no one then since that time been guilty of this? How was it then that they did not suffer the same punishment?  Do we then persuade you that there is a hell, or do you need more examples? Therefore we will proceed also to things that are unwritten, such as now take place in life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:179
verses.text: For it is necessary that this idea should be gathered by us from every quarter, that we may not, by vainly gratifying ourselves, do ourselves harm.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:180
verses.text: Do you not see many visited by calamities, maimed in their bodies, suffering infinite troubles, but others in good repute? For what reason do some suffer punishment for murders, and others not? Hear Paul saying, "Some men's sins are evident,…and some men they follow after".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:181
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:182
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:183
verses.text: ) How many murderers have escaped! how many violators of the tombs! But let these things pass.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:184
verses.text: How many do you not see visited with the severest punishment? Some have been delivered to a long disease, others to continued tortures, and others to numberless other ills.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:185
verses.text: When therefore you see one who has been guilty of the same things as they, or even much worse—and yet not suffering punishment, will you not suspect, even against your will, that there is a hell? Reckon those here who before you have been severely punished, consider that God is no respecter of persons, and that though you have done numberless wickednesses, you have suffered no such thing, and you will have the idea of hell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:186
verses.text: For God has so implanted that idea within us, that no one can ever be ignorant of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:187
verses.text: For poets and philosophers and fabulists, and in short all men, have philosophized concerning the retribution that is there, and have said that the greater number are punished in Hades.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:188
verses.text: And if those things are fables, yet what we have received are not so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:189
verses.text: I say not these things as wishing to frighten you, nor to lay a burden on your souls, but to make them wise, and render them easier.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:190
verses.text: I could wish also myself that there were no punishment—yes, myself most of all men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:191
verses.text: And why so? Because whilst each of you fears for his own soul, I have to answer for this office also in which I preside over you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:192
verses.text: So that most of all it is impossible for me to escape.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:193
verses.text: But it cannot be that there is not punishment and a hell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:194
verses.text: What can I do? Where then, they say, is the kindness of God to men? In many places.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:195
verses.text: But on this subject I will rather discourse at some other season, that we may not confuse the discourses concerning hell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:196
verses.text: In the meantime let not that slip, which we have gained.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:197
verses.text: For it is no small advantage to be persuaded concerning hell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:198
verses.text: For the recollection of such discourses, like some bitter medicine, will be able to clear off every vice, if it be constantly settled in your mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:199
verses.text: Let us therefore use it, that having a pure heart, we may so be thought worthy to see those things, which eye hath not seen, nor ear heard, nor have entered into the heart of man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 9:200
verses.text: Which may we all obtain by the grace and mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ, with whom, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:1
verses.text: Homily IX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:2
verses.text: Thessalonians v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:3
verses.text: ,  "But concerning the times and the seasons, brethren, ye have no need that aught be written unto you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:4
verses.text: For yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord so cometh as a thief in the night".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:5
verses.text: Nothing, as it seems, is so curious, and so fondly prone to pry into things obscure and concealed, as the nature of men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:6
verses.text: And this is wont to happen to it, when the mind is unsettled and in an imperfect state.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:7
verses.text: For the simpler sort of children never cease teasing their nurses, and tutors, and parents, with their frequent questions, in which there is nothing else but "when will this be?" and "when that?" And this comes to pass also from living in indulgence, and having nothing to do.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:8
verses.text: Many things therefore our mind is in haste to learn already and to comprehend, but especially concerning the period of the consummation; and what wonder if we are thus affected, for those holy men, themselves, were most of all affected in the same way? And before the Passion, the Apostles come and say to Christ, "Tell us, when shall these things be, and what shall be the sign of Thy coming, and of the end of the world?" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:9
verses.text: xxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:10
verses.text: ) And after the Passion and the Resurrection from the dead, they said to Him, Tell us, "dost Thou at this time restore again the kingdom to Israel?" (From Acts i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:11
verses.text: ) And they asked Him nothing sooner than this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:12
verses.text: But it was not so afterwards, when they had been vouchsafed the Holy Ghost.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:13
verses.text: Not only do they not themselves inquire, nor complain of this ignorance, but they repress those who labor under this unseasonable curiosity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:14
verses.text: Hear for instance what the blessed Paul now says, "But concerning the times and the seasons, brethren, ye have no need that aught be written unto you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:15
verses.text: Why has he not said that no one knows? why has he not said, that it is not revealed, instead of saying, "Ye have no need that aught be written unto you"? Because in that case he would have grieved them more, but by speaking thus he comforted them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:16
verses.text: For by the expression, "Ye have no need," as if it were both superfluous, and inexpedient, he suffers them not to enquire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:17
verses.text: For tell me, what would be the advantage? Let us suppose that the end would be after twenty or thirty or a hundred years, what is this to us? Is not the end of his own life the consummation to every individual? Why art thou curious, and travailest about the general end? But the case is the same with us in this, as in other things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:18
verses.text: For as in other things, leaving our own private concerns, we are anxious about things in general, saying, Such an one is a fornicator, such an one an adulterer, that man has robbed, another has been injurious; but no one takes account of what is his own, but each thinks of anything rather than his own private concerns; so here also, each omitting to take thought about his own end, we are anxious to hear about the general dissolution.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:19
verses.text: Now what concern is that of yours? for if you make your own a good end, you will suffer no harm from the other; be it far off, or be it near.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:20
verses.text: This is nothing to us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:21
verses.text: For this reason Christ did not tell it, because it was not expedient.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:22
verses.text: How, you say, was it not expedient? He who also concealed it knows wherefore it was not expedient.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:23
verses.text: For hear Him saying to His Apostles, "It is not for you to know times, or seasons, which the Father hath set within His own authority".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:24
verses.text: (Acts i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:25
verses.text: ) Why are you curious? Peter, the chief of the Apostles, and his fellows, heard this said, as if they were seeking things too great for them to know.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:26
verses.text: True, you say; but it were possible to stop the mouths of the Greeks in this way.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:27
verses.text: How? tell me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:28
verses.text: Because they say, that this world is a god; if we knew the period of its dissolution, we should have stopped their mouths.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:29
verses.text: Why, is this what will stop their mouths, to know when it will be destroyed, or to know that it will be destroyed? Tell them this, that it will have an end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:30
verses.text: If they do not believe this, neither will they believe the other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:31
verses.text: Hear Paul saying, "For yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord so cometh as a thief in the night".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:32
verses.text: Not the general day only, but that of every individual.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:33
verses.text: For the one resembles the other, is also akin to it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:34
verses.text: For what the one does collectively, that the other does partially.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:35
verses.text: For the period of consummation took its beginning from Adam, and then is the end of the consummation; since even now one would not err in calling it a consummation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:36
verses.text: For when ten thousand die every day, and all await That Day, and no one is raised before it, is it not the work of That Day? And if you would know on what account it is concealed, and why it so cometh as a thief in the night, I will tell you how I think I can well account for it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:37
verses.text: No one would have ever cultivated virtue during his whole life; but knowing his last day, and, after having committed numberless sins, then having come to the Laver, he would so have departed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:38
verses.text: For if now, when the fear arising from its uncertainty shakes the souls of all, still all, having spent their whole former life in wickedness, at their last breath give themselves up to Baptism,—if they had fully persuaded themselves concerning this matter, who would ever have cultivated virtue? If many have departed without Illumination, and not even this fear has taught them, whilst living, to cultivate the things that are pleasing to God; if this fear also had been removed, who would ever have been sober, or who gentle? There is not one! And another thing again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:39
verses.text: The fear of death and the love of life restrain many.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:40
verses.text: But if each one knew that to-morrow he would certainly die, there is nothing he would refuse to attempt before that day, but he would murder whomsoever he wished, and would retrieve himself by taking vengeance on his enemies, and would perpetrate ten thousand crimes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:41
verses.text: For a wicked man, who despairs of his life here, pays no regard even to him who is invested with the purple.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:42
verses.text: He therefore who was persuaded that he must at all events die would both be revenged upon his enemy, and after having first satisfied his own soul, so would meet his end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:43
verses.text: Let me mention also a third thing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:44
verses.text: Those who are fond of life, and vehemently attached to the things of this world, would be ruined by despair and grief.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:45
verses.text: For if any of the young knew that before he reached old age, he should meet his end, as the most sluggish of wild beasts, when they are taken, become still more sluggish from expecting their end, so would he also be affected.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:46
verses.text: Besides, not even the men that are courageous would have had their reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:47
verses.text: For if they knew that after three years they must certainly die, and before that time it was not possible, what reward would they have gained for daring in the face of dangers? For any one might say to them, Because you are confident of the three years of life, for this reason you throw yourselves into dangers, knowing that it is not possible for you to pass away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:48
verses.text: For he, that expects from each danger that he may come by his death, and knows that he shall live indeed, if he does not expose himself to peril, but shall die if he attempts such and such actions, he gives the greatest proof of his zeal, and of his contempt for the present life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:49
verses.text: And this I will make plain to you by an example.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:50
verses.text: Tell me, if the patriarch Abraham, foreknowing that he should not have to sacrifice his son, had brought him to the place, would he then have had any reward? And what if Paul, foreknowing that he should not die, had despised dangers, in what respect would he have been admirable? For so even the most sluggish would rush into the fire, if he could find any one he could trust to ensure his safety.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:51
verses.text: But not such were the Three Children.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:52
verses.text: For hear them saying, "O king, there is a God in heaven, who will deliver us out of thine hands, and out of this furnace; and if not, be it known to thee that we do not serve thy gods, nor worship the golden image which thou hast set up".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:53
verses.text: (Dan.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:54
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:55
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:56
verses.text: )  Ye see how many advantages there are, and yet there are more than these that arise from not knowing the time of our end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:57
verses.text: Meanwhile it is sufficient to learn these.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:58
verses.text: On this account He so cometh as a thief in the night; that we may not abandon ourselves to wickedness, nor to sloth; that He may not take from us our reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:59
verses.text: "For yourselves know perfectly," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:60
verses.text: Why then are you curious, if you are persuaded? But that the future is uncertain, learn from what Christ has said.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:61
verses.text: For that on this account He said it, hear what he says, "Watch therefore: for ye know not at what hour" the thief "cometh".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:62
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:63
verses.text: xxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:64
verses.text: ) On this account also Paul said,  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:65
verses.text: "When they are saying peace and safety, then sudden destruction cometh upon them, as travail upon a woman with child; and they shall in nowise escape".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:66
verses.text: Here he has glanced at something which he has also said in his second Epistle.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:67
verses.text: For since they indeed were in affliction, but they that warred on them at ease and in luxury, and then while he comforted them in their present sufferings by this mention of the Resurrection, the others insulted them with arguments taken from their forefathers, and said, When will it happen?—which the Prophets also said, "Woe unto them that say, Let him make speed, let God hasten his work, that we may see it: and let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel come, that we may know it!" (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:68
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:69
verses.text: ); and again "Woe unto them that desire the day of the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:70
verses.text: (Amos v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:71
verses.text: ) He means this day; for he does not speak simply of persons who desire it, but of those who desire it because they disbelieve it: and "the day of the Lord," he says, "is darkness, and not light"—see then how Paul consoles them, as if he had said, Let them not account their being in a prosperous state, a proof that the Judgment is not coming.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:72
verses.text: For so it is that it will come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:73
verses.text: But it may be worth while to ask, If Antichrist comes, and Elias comes, how is it "when they say Peace and safety," that then a sudden destruction comes upon them? For these things do not permit the day to come upon them unawares, being signs of its coming.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:74
verses.text: But he does not mean this to be the time of Antichrist, and the whole day, because that will be a sign of the coming of Christ, but Himself will not have a sign, but will come suddenly and unexpectedly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:75
verses.text: For travail, indeed, you say, does not come upon the pregnant woman unexpectedly: for she knows that after nine months the birth will take place.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:76
verses.text: And yet it is very uncertain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:77
verses.text: For some bring forth at the seventh month, and others at the ninth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:78
verses.text: And at any rate the day and the hour is uncertain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:79
verses.text: With respect to this therefore, Paul speaks thus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:80
verses.text: And the image is exact.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:81
verses.text: For there are not many sure signs of travail; many indeed have brought forth in the high roads, or when out of their houses and abroad, not foreseeing it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:82
verses.text: And he has not only glanced here at the uncertainty, but also at the bitterness of the pain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:83
verses.text: For as she while sporting, laughing, not looking for anything at all, being suddenly seized with unspeakable pains, is pierced through with the pangs of labor—so will it be with those souls, when the Day comes upon them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:84
verses.text: "And they shall in nowise escape".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:85
verses.text: As he was saying just now.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:86
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:87
verses.text: "But ye, brethren, are not in darkness, that that day should overtake you as a thief".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:88
verses.text: Here he speaks of a life that is dark and impure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:89
verses.text: For it is just as corrupt and wicked men do all things as in the night, escaping the notice of all, and inclosing themselves in darkness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:90
verses.text: For tell me, does not the adulterer watch for the evening, and the thief for the night? Does not the violator of the tombs carry on all his trade in the night? What then? Does it not overtake them as a thief? Does it not come upon them also uncertainly, but do they know it beforehand? How then does he say, "Ye have no need that aught be written unto you"? He speaks here not with respect to the uncertainty, but with respect to the calamity, that is, it will not come as an evil to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:91
verses.text: For it will come uncertainly indeed even to them, but it will involve them in no trouble.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:92
verses.text: "That that Day," he says, "may not overtake you as a thief".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:93
verses.text: For in the case of those who are watching and who are in the light, if there should be any entry of a robber, it can do them no harm: so also it is with those who live well.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:94
verses.text: But those who are sleeping he will strip of everything, and go off; that is, those who are trusting in the things of this life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:95
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:96
verses.text: "For ye are all," he says, "sons of light, and sons of the day".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:97
verses.text: And how is it possible to be "sons of the day"? Just as it is said, "sons of destruction" and "sons of hell".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:98
verses.text: Wherefore Christ also said to the Pharisees, "Woe unto you—for ye compass sea and land to make one proselyte, and when he is become so, ye make him a son of hell".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:99
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:100
verses.text: xxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:101
verses.text: ) And again Paul said, "For which things' sake cometh the wrath of God upon the sons of disobedience".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:102
verses.text: (Col.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:103
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:104
verses.text: ) That is, those who do the works of hell and the works of disobedience.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:105
verses.text: So also sons of God are those who do things pleasing to God; so also sons of day and sons of light, those who do the works of light.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:106
verses.text: "And we are not of the night nor of darkness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:107
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:109
verses.text: "So then let us not sleep, as do also the rest, but let us watch and be sober.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:110
verses.text: For they that sleep sleep in the night; and they that be drunken are drunken in the night.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:111
verses.text: But let us, since we are of the day, be sober".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:112
verses.text: Here he shows, that to be in the day depends on ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:113
verses.text: For here indeed, in the case of the present day and night, it does not depend on ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:114
verses.text: But night comes even against our will, and sleep overtakes us when we do not wish it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:115
verses.text: But with respect to that night and that sleep, it is not so, but it is in our power always to have it day, it is in our power always to watch.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:116
verses.text: For to shut the eyes of the soul, and to bring on the sleep of wickedness, is not of nature, but of our own choice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:117
verses.text: "But let us watch," he says, "and be sober".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:118
verses.text: For it is possible to sleep while awake, by doing nothing good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:119
verses.text: Wherefore he has added, "and be sober".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:120
verses.text: For even by day, if any one watches, but is not sober, he will fall into numberless dangers, so that sobriety is the intensity of watchfulness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:121
verses.text: "They that sleep," he says, "sleep in the night, and they that be drunken are drunken in the night".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:122
verses.text: The drunkenness he here speaks of is not that from wine only, but that also which comes of all vices.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:123
verses.text: For riches and the desire of wealth is a drunkenness of the soul, and so carnal lust; and every sin you can name is a drunkenness of the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:124
verses.text: On what account then has he called vice sleep? Because in the first place the vicious man is inactive with respect to virtue: again, because he sees everything as a vision, he views nothing in its true light, but is full of dreams, and oftentimes of unreasonable actions: and if he sees anything good, he has no firmness, no fixedness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:125
verses.text: Such is the present life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:126
verses.text: It is full of dreams, and of phantasy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:127
verses.text: Riches are a dream, and glory, and everything of that sort.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:128
verses.text: He who sleeps sees not things that are and have a real subsistence, but things that are not he fancies as things that are.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:129
verses.text: Such is vice, and the life that is passed in vice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:130
verses.text: It sees not things that are, that is, spiritual, heavenly, abiding things, but things that are fleeting and fly away, and that soon recede from us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:131
verses.text: But it is not sufficient to watch and be sober, we must also be armed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:132
verses.text: For if a man watch and is sober, but has not arms, the robbers soon dispatch him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:133
verses.text: When therefore we ought both to watch, and to be sober, and to be armed, and we are unarmed and naked and asleep, who will hinder him from thrusting home his sword? Wherefore showing this also, that we have need of arms, he has added:  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:134
verses.text: "Putting on the breastplate of faith and love: and for a helmet the hope of salvation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:135
verses.text: "Of faith and love," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:136
verses.text: Here he glances at life and doctrine.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:137
verses.text: He has shown what it is to watch and be sober, to have "the breastplate of faith and love".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:138
verses.text: Not a common faith, he says, but as nothing can soon pierce through a breastplate, but it is a safe wall to the breast;—so do thou also, he says, surround thy soul with faith and love, and none of the fiery darts of the devil can ever be fixed in it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:139
verses.text: For where the power of the soul is preoccupied with the armor of love, all the devices of those who plot against it are vain and ineffectual.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:140
verses.text: For neither wickedness, nor hatred, nor envy, nor flattery, nor hypocrisy, nor any other thing will be able to penetrate such a soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:141
verses.text: He has not simply said "love," but he has bid them put it on as a strong breastplate.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:142
verses.text: "And for a helmet the hope of salvation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:143
verses.text: For as the helmet guards the vital part in us, surrounding the head and covering it on every side, so also this hope does not suffer the reason to falter, but sets it upright as the head, not permitting anything from without to fall upon it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:144
verses.text: And whilst nothing falls on it, neither does it slip of itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:145
verses.text: For it is not possible that one who is fortified with such arms as these, should ever fall.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:146
verses.text: For "now abideth faith, hope, love".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:147
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:148
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:149
verses.text: ) Then having said, Put on, and array yourselves, he himself provides the armor, whence faith, hope, and love may be produced, and may become strong.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:150
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:151
verses.text: "For God appointed us not unto wrath, but unto the obtaining of salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ, who died for us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:152
verses.text: Thus God has not inclined to this, that He might destroy us, but that He might save us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:153
verses.text: And whence is it manifest that this is His will? He has given His own Son for us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:154
verses.text: So does He desire that we should be saved, that He has given His Son, and not merely given, but given Him to death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:155
verses.text: From these considerations hope is produced.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:156
verses.text: For do not despair of thyself, O man, in going to God, who has not spared even His Son for thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:157
verses.text: Faint not at present evils.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:158
verses.text: He who gave His Only-Begotten, that He might save thee and deliver thee from hell, what will He spare henceforth for thy salvation? So that thou oughtest to hope for all things kind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:159
verses.text: For neither should we fear, if we were going to a judge who was about to judge us, and who had shown so much love for us, as to have sacrificed his son.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:160
verses.text: Let us hope therefore for kind and great things, for we have received the principal thing; let us believe, for we have seen an example; let us love, for it is the extreme of madness for one not to love who has been so treated.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:161
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:163
verses.text: "That, whether we wake or sleep," he says, "we should live together with Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:164
verses.text: Wherefore exhort one another, and build each other up, even as also ye do".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:165
verses.text: And again, "whether we wake or sleep"; by sleep there he means one thing, and here another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:166
verses.text: For here, "whether we sleep" signifies the death of the body; that is, fear not dangers; though we should die, we shall live.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:167
verses.text: Do not despair because thou art in danger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:168
verses.text: Thou hast a strong security.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:169
verses.text: He would not have given His Son if He had not been inflamed by vehement love for us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:170
verses.text: So that, though thou shouldest die, thou wilt live; for He Himself also died.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:171
verses.text: Therefore whether we die, or whether we live, we shall live with Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:172
verses.text: This is a matter of indifference: it is no concern of mine, whether I live or die; for we shall live with Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:173
verses.text: Let us therefore do everything for that life: looking to that, let us do all our works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:174
verses.text: Vice, O beloved, is darkness, it is death, it is night; we see nothing that we ought, we do nothing that becomes us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:175
verses.text: As the dead are unsightly and of evil odor, so also the souls of those who are vicious are full of much impurity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:176
verses.text: Their eyes are closed, their mouth is stopped, they remain without motion in the bed of vice; or rather more wretched than those who are naturally dead.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:177
verses.text: For they truly are dead to both, but these are insensible indeed to virtue, but alive to vice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:178
verses.text: If one should strike a dead man, he perceives it not, he revenges it not, but is like a dry stick.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:179
verses.text: So also his soul is truly dry, having lost its life; it receives daily numberless wounds, and has no feeling of any, but lies insensible to everything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:180
verses.text: One would not err in comparing such men to those who are mad, or drunk, or delirious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:181
verses.text: All these things belong to vice, and it is worse than all these.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:182
