verses.text: He that is mad is much allowed for by those who see him, for his disease is not from choice, but from nature alone; but how shall he be pardoned, who lives in vice? Whence then is vice? whence are the majority bad? Tell me, whence have diseases their evil nature? whence is frenzy? whence is lethargy? Is it not from carelessness? If physical disorders have their origin in choice, much more those which are voluntary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:183
verses.text: Whence is drunkenness? Is it not from intemperance of soul? Is not frenzy from excess of fever? And is not fever from the elements too abundant in us? And is not this superabundance of elements from our carelessness? For when either from deficiency or excess we carry any of the things within us beyond the bounds of moderation, we kindle that fire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:184
verses.text: Again, if when the fire is kindled, we continue to neglect it, we make a conflagration for ourselves, which we are not able to extinguish.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:185
verses.text: So is it also with vice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:186
verses.text: When we do not restrain it at its beginning, nor cut it off, we cannot afterwards reach to the end of it, but it becomes too great for our power.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:187
verses.text: Wherefore, I beseech you, let us do everything that we may never become drowsy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:188
verses.text: Do you not see that when sentinels have only given way a little to sleep, they derive no advantage from their long watch, for by that little they have ruined the whole, having given perfect security to him who is prepared to steal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:189
verses.text: For as we do not see thieves in the same way that they see us, so also the devil most of all is ever instant, and lying in wait, and grinding his teeth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:190
verses.text: Let us not then slumber.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:191
verses.text: Let us not say, on this side there is nothing, on that side nothing; we are often plundered from a quarter whence we did not expect it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:192
verses.text: So it is with vice; we perish from a quarter whence we did not expect it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:193
verses.text: Let us look carefully round upon all things, let us not be drunken, and we shall not sleep.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:194
verses.text: Let us not be luxurious, and we shall not slumber.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:195
verses.text: Let us not be mad for external things, and we shall continue in sobriety.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:196
verses.text: Let us discipline ourselves on every side.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:197
verses.text: And as men who walk upon a tight rope cannot be off their guard ever so little, for that little causes great mischief: for the man losing his balance is at once precipitated down and perishes; so neither is it possible for us to be off our guard.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:198
verses.text: We walk upon a narrow road intercepted by precipices on either side, not admitting of two feet at the same time.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:199
verses.text: Seest thou not how much carefulness is necessary? Seest thou not how those who travel on such roads guard not only their feet, but their eyes also? For if he should choose to gaze on one side, though his foot stand firm, his eye becoming dizzy from the depth, plunges the whole body down.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:200
verses.text: But he must take heed to himself and to his steps; wherefore he says, "neither to the right hand, nor to the left".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:201
verses.text: (Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:202
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:203
verses.text: ) Great is the depth of vice, high the precipices, much darkness below.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:204
verses.text: Let us take heed to the narrow way, let us walk with fear and trembling.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:205
verses.text: No one, who is traveling such a road, is dissolved in laughter nor heavy with drunkenness, but travels such a road with sobriety and fasting.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:206
verses.text: No one traveling such a road carries with him any superfluities; for he would be contented even lightly equipped to be able to escape.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:207
verses.text: No one entangles his own feet, but leaves them disengaged, and free to move.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:208
verses.text: But we, chaining ourselves down with numberless cares, and carrying with us the numberless burdens of this life, staring about, and loosely rambling, how do we expect to travel in that narrow road? He has not merely said that "narrow is the way" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:209
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:210
verses.text: ), but with wonder, "how narrow is the way," that is, exceedingly narrow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:211
verses.text: And this we also do in things that are quite objects of wonder.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:212
verses.text: And "straitened," he says, "is the way which leadeth unto life".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:213
verses.text: And he has well said it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:214
verses.text: For when we are bound to give an account of our thoughts, and words, and actions, and all things, truly it is narrow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:215
verses.text: But we ourselves make it more narrow, spreading out and widening ourselves, and shuffling out our feet.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:216
verses.text: For the narrow way is difficult to every one, but especially to him who is incumbered with fat, as he who makes himself lean will not perceive its narrowness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:217
verses.text: So that he who has practiced himself in being pinched, will not be discouraged at its pressure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:218
verses.text: Let not any one therefore expect that he shall see heaven with ease.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:219
verses.text: For it cannot be.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:220
verses.text: Let no one hope to travel the narrow road with luxury, for it is impossible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:221
verses.text: Let no one traveling in the broad way hope for life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:222
verses.text: When therefore thou seest such and such an one luxuriating in baths, in a sumptuous table, or in other matters having troops of attendants; think not thyself unhappy, as not partaking of these things, but lament for him, that he is traveling the way to destruction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:223
verses.text: For what is the advantage of this way, when it ends in tribulation? And what is the injury of that straitness, when it leads to rest? Tell me, if any one invited to a palace should walk through narrow ways painful and precipitous, and another led to death should be dragged through the midst of the market-place, which shall we call happy? which shall we commiserate? Him, shall we not, who walks through the broad road? So also now, let us think happy, not those who are luxurious, but those who are not luxurious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:224
verses.text: These are hastening to heaven, those to hell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:225
verses.text: And perhaps indeed many of them will even laugh at the things that are said by us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:226
verses.text: But I most of all lament and bewail them on this account, that they do not even know what they ought to laugh at, and for what they ought especially to mourn, but they confound and disturb and disorder everything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:227
verses.text: On this account I bewail them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:228
verses.text: What sayest thou, O man, when thou art to rise again, and to give an account of thy actions, and to undergo the last sentence, dost thou pay no regard indeed to these, but give thought to gratifying thy belly, and being drunken? And dost thou laugh at these things? But I bewail thee, knowing the evils that await thee, the punishment that is about to overtake thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:229
verses.text: And this I most especially bewail, that thou dost laugh! Mourn with me, bewail with me thine own evils.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:230
verses.text: Tell me, if one of thy friends perishes, dost thou not turn from those who laugh at his end, and think them enemies, but love those who weep and sympathize with thee? Then indeed if the dead body of thy wife were laid out, thou turnest from him that laughs: but when thy soul is done to death, dost thou turn from him that weeps, and laugh thyself? Seest thou how the devil has disposed us to be enemies and adversaries to ourselves? For once let us be sober, let us open our eyes, let us watch, let us lay hold on eternal life, let us shake off this long sleep.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:231
verses.text: There is a Judgment, there is a Punishment, there is a Resurrection, there is an Inquisition into what we have done! The Lord cometh in the clouds "Before Him," he says, "a fire will be kindled, and round about Him a mighty tempest" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:232
verses.text: l.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:233
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:234
verses.text: ) A river of fire rolls before him, the undying worm, unquenchable fire, outer darkness, gnashing of teeth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:235
verses.text: Although you should be angry with me ten thousand times for mentioning these things, I shall not cease from mentioning them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:236
verses.text: For if the prophets, though stoned, did not keep silence, much more ought we to bear with enmities, and not to discourse to you with a view to please, that we may not, for having deceived you, be ourselves cut in sunder.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:237
verses.text: There is punishment, deathless, unallayed, and no one to stand up for us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:238
verses.text: "Who will pity," he says, "the charmer that is bitten by a serpent?" (Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:239
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:240
verses.text: ) When we pity not our own selves, tell me, who will pity us? If you see a man piercing himself with a sword, will you be able to spare his life? By no means.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:241
verses.text: Much more, when having it in our power to do well we do not do well, who will spare us? No one! Let us pity ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:242
verses.text: When we pray to God, saying, "Lord, have mercy upon me," let us say it to ourselves, and have mercy upon ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:243
verses.text: We are the arbiters of God's having mercy upon us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:244
verses.text: This grace He has bestowed upon us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:245
verses.text: If we do things worthy of mercy, worthy of His loving-kindness towards us, God will have mercy upon us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:246
verses.text: But if we have not mercy on ourselves, who will spare us? Have mercy on thy neighbor, and thou shalt find mercy of God Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:247
verses.text: How many every day come to thee, saying, "Have pity on me," and thou dost not turn towards them; how many naked, how many maimed, and we do not bend toward them, but dismiss their supplications.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 10:248
verses.text: How then dost thou claim to obtain mercy, when thou thyself dost nothing worthy of mercy? Let us become compassionate, let us become pitiful, that so we may be well-pleasing to God, and obtain the good things promised to those that love Him, by the grace and lovingkindness of our Lord Jesus Christ, with whom, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:1
verses.text: Homily X.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:2
verses.text: Thessalonians v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:3
verses.text: ,  "But we beseech you, brethren, to know them that labor among you, and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you; and to esteem them exceeding highly in love for their work's sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:4
verses.text: Be at peace among yourselves".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:5
verses.text: It must needs happen that a ruler should have many occasions of enmities.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:6
verses.text: As physicians are compelled to give much trouble to the sick, preparing for them both diet and medicines that are not pleasant indeed, but attended with benefit; and as fathers are often annoying to their children: so also are teachers, and much more.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:7
verses.text: For the physician, though he be odious to the sick man, yet has the relations and friends on good terms with him, nay, and often the sick man himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:8
verses.text: And a father also, both from the force of nature and from external laws, exercises his dominion over his son with great ease; and if he should chastise and chide his son against his will, there is no one to prevent him, nor will the son himself be able to raise a look against him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:9
verses.text: But in the case of the Priest there is a great difficulty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:10
verses.text: For in the first place, he ought to be ruling people willing to obey, and thankful to him for his rule; but it is not possible that this should soon come to pass.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:11
verses.text: For he who is convicted and reproved, be he what he may, is sure to cease from being thankful, and to become an enemy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:12
verses.text: In like manner he will act who is advised, and he who is admonished and he who is exhorted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:13
verses.text: If therefore I should say, empty out wealth on the needy, I say what is offensive and burdensome.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:14
verses.text: If I say, chastise thine anger, quench thy wrath, check thine inordinate desire, cut off a small portion of thy luxury, all is burdensome and offensive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:15
verses.text: And if I should punish one who is slothful, or should remove him from the Church, or exclude him from the public prayers, he grieves, not because he is deprived of these things, but because of the public disgrace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:16
verses.text: For this is an aggravation of the evil, that, being interdicted from spiritual things, we grieve not on account of our deprivation of these great blessings, but because of our disgrace in the sight of others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:17
verses.text: We do not shudder at, do not dread, the thing itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:18
verses.text: For this reason Paul from one end to the other discourses largely concerning these persons.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:19
verses.text: And Christ indeed has subjected them with so strict a necessity, that He says, "The Scribes and the Pharisees sit on Moses' seat.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:20
verses.text: All things therefore whatsoever they bid you, these do and observe: but do not ye after their works".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:21
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:22
verses.text: xxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:24
verses.text: ) And again, when He healed the leper, He said, "Go thy way, show thyself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded for a testimony unto them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:25
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:26
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:27
verses.text: ) And yet Thou sayest, "Ye make him twofold more a son of hell than yourselves".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:28
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:29
verses.text: xxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:30
verses.text: ) For this reason I said, answers He, "Do not the things which they do".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:31
verses.text: Therefore he hath shut out all excuse from him that is under rule.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:32
verses.text: In his Epistle to Timothy also this Apostle said, "Let the elders that rule well be counted worthy of double honor".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:33
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:34
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:35
verses.text: ) And in his Epistle to the Hebrews also he said, "Obey them that have the rule over you, and submit to them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:36
verses.text: (Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:37
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:38
verses.text: ) And here again, "But we beseech you, brethren, to know them that labor among you, and are over you in the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:39
verses.text: For since he had said, "build each other up," lest they should think that he raised them to the rank of teachers, he has added, See, however, that I gave leave to you also to edify one another, for it is not possible for a teacher to say everything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:40
verses.text: "Them that labor among you," he says, "and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:41
verses.text: And how, he says, is it not absurd? If a man stand up for thee before a man, thou doest anything, thou confessest thyself much indebted; but he stands up for thee before God, and thou dost not own the favor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:42
verses.text: And how does he stand up for me? thou sayest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:43
verses.text: Because he prays for thee, because he ministers to thee the spiritual gift that is by Baptism, he visits, he advises and admonishes thee, he comes at midnight if thou callest for him; he is nothing else than the constant subject of thy mouth, and he bears thy injurious speeches.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:44
verses.text: What necessity had he? Has he done well or ill? Thou indeed hast a wife, and livest luxuriously, and choosest a life of commerce.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:45
verses.text: But from this the Priest has hindered himself by his occupation; his life is no other than to be employed about the Church.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:46
verses.text: "And to esteem them," he says, "exceeding highly in love for their work's sake; be at peace with them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:47
verses.text: Seest thou how well he is aware that unpleasant feelings arise? He does not merely say "love," but "very highly," as children love their fathers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:48
verses.text: For through them ye were begotten by that eternal generation: through them you have obtained the kingdom: through their hands all things are done, through them the gates of heaven are opened to you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:49
verses.text: Let no one raise divisions, let no one be contentious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:50
verses.text: He who loves Christ, whatever the Priest may be, will love him, because through him he has obtained the awful Mysteries.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:51
verses.text: Tell me, if wishing to see a palace resplendent with much gold, and radiant with the brightness of precious stones, thou couldest find him who had the key, and he being called upon immediately opened it, and admitted thee within, wouldest thou not prefer him above all men? Wouldest thou not love him as dearly as thine eyes? Wouldest thou not kiss him? This man hath opened heaven to thee, and thou dost not kiss him, nor pay him court.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:52
verses.text: If thou hast a wife, dost thou not love him above all, who procured her for thee? So if thou lovest Christ, if thou lovest the kingdom of heaven, acknowledge through whom thou obtainedst it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:53
verses.text: On this account he says, "for their work's sake, be at peace with them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:54
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:55
verses.text: "And we exhort you, brethren, admonish the disorderly, encourage the faint-hearted, support the weak, be long suffering toward all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:56
verses.text: Here he addresses those who have rule.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:57
verses.text: Admonish, he says, "the disorderly," not of imperiousness, he says, nor of self-will rebuke them, but with admonition.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:58
verses.text: "Encourage the fainthearted, support the weak, be longsuffering toward all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:59
verses.text: For he who is rebuked with harshness, despairing of himself, becomes more bold in contempt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:60
verses.text: On this account it is necessary by admonition to render the medicine sweet.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:61
verses.text: But who are the disorderly? All those who do what is contrary to the will of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:62
verses.text: For this order of the Church is more harmonious than the order of an army; so that the reviler is disorderly, the drunkard is disorderly, and the covetous, and all who sin; for they walk not orderly in their rank, but out of the line, wherefore also they are overthrown.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:63
verses.text: But there is also another kind of evils, not such as this indeed, but itself also a vice, little mindedness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:64
verses.text: For this is destructive equally with sloth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:65
verses.text: He who cannot bear an insult is feeble-minded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:66
verses.text: He who cannot endure trial is feeble-minded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:67
verses.text: This is he who is sown upon the rock.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:68
verses.text: There is also another sort, that of weakness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:69
verses.text: "Support the weak," he says; now weakness occurs in regard to faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:70
verses.text: But observe how he does not permit them to be despised.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:71
verses.text: And elsewhere also in his Epistles he says, "Them that are weak in the faith receive ye".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:72
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:73
verses.text: xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:74
verses.text: ) For in our bodies too we do not suffer the weak member to perish.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:75
verses.text: "Be longsuffering toward all," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:76
verses.text: Even toward the disorderly? Yes, certainly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:77
verses.text: For there is no medicine equal to this, especially for the teacher, none so suitable to those who are under rule.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:78
verses.text: It can quite shame and put out of countenance him that is fiercer and more shameless than all men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:79
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:80
verses.text: "See that none render unto any one evil for evil".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:81
verses.text: If we ought not to render evil for evil, much less evil for good; much less, when evil has not been previously done, to render evil, Such an one, you say, is a bad man, and has aggrieved me, and done me much injury.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:82
verses.text: Do you wish to revenge yourself upon him? Do not retaliate.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:83
verses.text: Leave him unpunished.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:84
verses.text: Well, is this the stopping-place? By no means;  "But alway follow after that which is good, one toward another, and toward all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:85
verses.text: This is the higher philosophy, not only not to requite evil with evil, but to render good for evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:86
verses.text: For this is truly revenge that brings harm to him and advantage to thyself, or rather great advantage even to him, if he will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:87
verses.text: And that thou mayest not think that this is said with respect to the faithful, therefore he has said, "both one toward another and toward all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:88
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:89
verses.text: "Rejoice alway".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:90
verses.text: This is said with respect to the temptations that bring in affliction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:91
verses.text: Hear ye, as many as have fallen into poverty, or into distressing circumstances.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:92
verses.text: For from these joy is engendered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:93
verses.text: For when we possess such a soul that we take revenge on no one, but do good to all, whence, tell me, will the sting of grief be able to enter into us? For he who so rejoices in suffering evil, as to requite even with benefits him that has done him evil, whence can he afterwards suffer grief? And how, you say, is this possible? It is possible, if we will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:94
verses.text: Then also he shows the way.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:95
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:97
verses.text: "Pray without ceasing; In every thing giving thanks: for this is the will of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:98
verses.text: Always to give thanks, this is a mark of a philosophic soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:99
verses.text: Hast thou suffered any evil? But if thou wilt, it is no evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:100
verses.text: Give thanks to God, and the evil is changed into good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:101
verses.text: Say thou also as Job said, "Blessed be the name of the Lord for ever".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:102
verses.text: (Job i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:103
verses.text: ) For tell me, what such great thing hast thou suffered? Has disease befallen thee? Yet it is nothing strange.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:104
verses.text: For our body is mortal, and liable to suffer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:105
verses.text: Has a want of possessions overtaken thee? But these also are things to be acquired, and again to be lost, and that abide here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:106
verses.text: But is it plots and false accusations of enemies? But it is not we that are injured by these, but they who are the authors of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:107
verses.text: "For the soul," he says, "that sinneth, itself shall also die".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:108
verses.text: (Ezek.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:109
verses.text: xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:110
verses.text: ) And he has not sinned who suffers the evil, but he who has done the evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:111
verses.text: Upon him therefore that is dead you ought not to take revenge, but to pray for him that you may deliver him from death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:112
verses.text: Do you not see how the bee dies upon the sting? By that animal God instructs us not to grieve our neighbors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:113
verses.text: For we ourselves receive death first.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:114
verses.text: For by striking them perhaps we have pained them for a little time, but we ourselves shall not live any longer, even as that animal will not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:115
verses.text: And yet the Scripture commends it, saying that it is a worker, whose work kings and private men make use of for their health.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:116
verses.text: (Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:117
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:118
verses.text: ) But this does not preserve it from dying, but it must needs perish.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:119
verses.text: And if its other excellence does not deliver it when it does injury, much less will it us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:120
verses.text: For indeed it is the part of the fiercest beasts, when no one has injured thee, to begin the injury, or rather not even of beasts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:121
verses.text: For they, if thou permittest them to feed in the wilderness, and dost not by straitening them reduce them to necessity, will never harm thee, nor come near thee, nor bite thee, but will go their own way.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:122
verses.text: But you being a rational man, honored with so much rule and honor and glory, do not even imitate the beasts in your conduct to your fellow-creature, but you injure your brother, and devour him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:123
verses.text: And how will you be able to excuse yourself? Do you not hear Paul saying, "Why not rather take wrong? Why not rather be defrauded? Nay, but ye yourselves do wrong, and defraud, and that your brethren".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:124
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:125
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:127
verses.text: ) Do you see that suffering wrong consists in doing wrong, but that to suffer wrongfully is to receive a benefit? For tell me, if any one were to revile his rulers, if he were to insult those in power, whom does he injure? Himself, or them? Clearly himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:128
verses.text: Then he who insults a ruler insults not him, but himself—and he that insults a Christian does he not through him insult Christ? By no means, thou sayest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:129
verses.text: What sayest thou? He that casts a stone at the images of the king (Emperor), at whom does he cast a stone? is it not at himself? Then does he who casts a stone at the image of an earthly king, cast a stone at himself, and does not he who insults the image of God (for man is the image of God) injure himself?  How long shall we love riches? For I shall not cease exclaiming against them: for they are the cause of everything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:130
verses.text: How long do we not get our fill of this insatiable desire? What is the good of gold? I am astonished at the thing! There is some enchantment in the business, that gold and silver should be so highly valued among us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:131
verses.text: For our own souls indeed we have no regard, but those lifeless images engross much attention.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:132
verses.text: Whence is it that this disease has invaded the world? Who shall be able to effect its destruction? What reason can cut off this evil beast, and destroy it with utter destruction? The desire is deep sown in the minds of men, even of those who seem to be religious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:133
verses.text: Let us be put to shame by the commands of the Gospel.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:134
verses.text: Words only lie there in Scripture, they are nowhere shown by works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:135
verses.text: And what is the specious plea of the many? I have children, one says, and I am afraid lest I myself be reduced to the extremity of hunger and want, lest I should stand in need of others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:136
verses.text: I am ashamed to beg.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:137
verses.text: For that reason therefore do you cause others to beg? I cannot, you say, endure hunger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:138
verses.text: For that reason do you expose others to hunger? Do you know what a dreadful thing it is to beg, how dreadful to be perishing by hunger? Spare also your brethren! Are you ashamed, tell me, to be hungry, and are you not ashamed to rob? Are you afraid to perish by hunger, and not afraid to destroy others? And yet to be hungry is neither a disgrace nor a crime; but to cast others into such a state brings not only disgrace, but extreme punishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:139
verses.text: All these are pretenses, words, trifles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:140
verses.text: For that it is not on account of your children that you act thus, they testify who indeed have no children, nor will have, but who yet toil and harass themselves, and are busy in acquiring wealth, as much as if they had innumerable children to leave it to.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:141
verses.text: It is not the care for his children that makes a man covetous, but a disease of the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:142
verses.text: On this account many even who have not children are mad about riches, and others living with a great number of children even despise what they have.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:143
verses.text: They will accuse thee in that Day.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:144
verses.text: For if the necessities of children compelled men to accumulate riches, they also must necessarily have the same longing, the same lust.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:145
verses.text: And if they have not, it is not from the number of children that we are thus mad, but from the love of money.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:146
verses.text: And who are they, you say, who having children, yet despise riches? Many, and in many places.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:147
verses.text: And if you will allow me, I will speak also of instances among the ancients.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:148
verses.text: Had not Jacob twelve children? Did he not lead the life of a hireling? Was he not wronged by his kinsman? and did he not often disappoint him? And did his number of children ever compel him to have recourse to any dishonest counsel? What was the case with Abraham? With Isaac, had he not also many other children? What then? Did he not possess all he had for the benefit of strangers? Do you see, how he not only did not do wrong, but even gave up his possessions, not only doing good, but choosing to be wronged by his nephew? For to endure being robbed for the sake of God is a much greater thing than to do good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:149
verses.text: Why? Because the one is the fruit of the soul and of free choice, whence also it is easily performed: but the other is injurious treatment and violence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:150
verses.text: And a man will more easily throw away ten thousand talents voluntarily, and will not think that he has suffered any harm, than he will bear meekly being robbed of three pence against his will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:151
verses.text: So that this rather is philosophy of soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:152
verses.text: And this, we see, happened in the case of Abraham.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:153
verses.text: "For Lot," it is said, "beheld all the plain; and it was well watered as the garden of God, and he chose it".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:154
verses.text: (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:155
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:157
verses.text: ) And Abraham said nothing against it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:158
verses.text: Seest thou, that he not only did not wrong him, but he was even wronged by him? Why, O man, dost thou accuse thine own children? God did not give us children for this end, that we should seize the possessions of others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:159
verses.text: Take care, lest in saying this thou provoke God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:160
verses.text: For if thou sayest that thy children are the causes of thy grasping and thine avarice, I fear lest thou be deprived of them, as injuring and ensnaring thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:161
verses.text: God hath given thee children that they may support thine old age, that they may learn virtue from thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:162
verses.text: For God on this account hath willed that mankind should thus be held together, providing for two most important objects: on the one hand, appointing fathers to be teachers, and on the other, implanting great love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:163
verses.text: For if men were merely to come into being, no one would have any relation towards any other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:164
verses.text: For if now, when there are the relations of fathers, and children, and grandchildren, many do not regard many, much more would it then be the case.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:165
verses.text: On this account God hath given thee children.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:166
verses.text: Do not therefore accuse the children.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:167
verses.text: But if they who have children have no excuse, what can they say for themselves, who having no children wear themselves out about the acquisition of riches? But they have a saying for themselves, which is destitute of all excuse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:168
verses.text: And what is this? That, instead of children we may have, they say, may have our riches as a memorial.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:169
verses.text: This is truly ridiculous.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:170
verses.text: Instead of children, one says, my house becomes the immortal memorial of my glory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:171
verses.text: Not of thy glory, O man, will it be the memorial, but of thy covetousness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:172
verses.text: Dost thou not see how many now as they pass the magnificent houses say one to another, What frauds, what robberies such an one committed, that he might build this house, and now he is become dust and ashes, and his house has passed into the inheritance of others! It is not of thy glory then that thou leavest a memorial, but of thy covetousness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:173
verses.text: And thy body indeed is concealed in the earth, but thou dost not permit the memorial of thy covetousness to be concealed, as it might have been by length of time, but causest it to be turned up and disinterred through thy house.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:174
verses.text: For as long as this stands, bearing thy name, and called such an one's, certainly the mouths of all too must needs be opened against thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:175
verses.text: Dost thou see that it is better to have nothing than to sustain such an accusation?  And these things indeed here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:176
verses.text: But what shall we do There? tell me, having so much at our disposal here, if we have imparted to no one of our possessions, or at least very little; how shall we put off our dishonest gains? For he that wishes to put off covetous gain, does not give a little out of a great deal, but many times more than he has robbed, and he ceases from robbing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:177
verses.text: Hear what Zacchaeus says, "And for as many things as I have taken wrongfully, I restore fourfold".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:178
verses.text: (Luke xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:179
verses.text: ) But thou, taking wrongfully ten thousand talents, if thou give a few drachmas, thinkest thou hast restored the whole, and art affected as if thou hadst given more.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:180
verses.text: And even this grudgingly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:181
verses.text: Why? Because thou oughtest both to have restored these, and to have added other out of thine own private possessions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:182
verses.text: For as the thief is not excused when he gives back only what he has stolen, but often he has added even his life; and often he compounds upon restoring many times as much: so also should the covetous man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:183
verses.text: For the covetous man also is a thief and a robber, far worse than the other, by how much he is also more tyrannical.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:184
verses.text: He indeed by being concealed, and by making his attack in the night, cuts off much of the audacity of the attempt, as if he were ashamed, and feared to sin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:185
verses.text: But the other having no sense of shame, with open face in the middle of the market-place steals the property of all, being at once a thief and a tyrant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:186
verses.text: He does not break through walls, nor extinguish the lamp, nor open a chest, nor tear off seals.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:187
verses.text: But what? He does things more insolent than these, in the sight of those who are injured he carries things out by the door, he with confidence opens everything, he compels them to expose all their possessions themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:188
verses.text: Such is the excess of his violence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:189
verses.text: This man is more wicked than those, inasmuch as he is more shameless and tyrannical.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:190
verses.text: For he that has suffered by fraud is indeed grieved, but he has no small consolation, that he who injured him was afraid of him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:191
verses.text: But he who together with the injury he suffers is also despised, will not be able to endure the violence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:192
verses.text: For the ridicule is greater.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:193
verses.text: Tell me, if one committed adultery with a woman in secret, and another committed it in the sight of her husband, who grieved him the most, and was most apt to wound him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:194
verses.text: For he indeed, together with the wrong he has done, treated him also with contempt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:195
verses.text: But the former, if he did nothing else, showed at least that he feared him whom he injured.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:196
verses.text: So also in the case of money.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:197
verses.text: He that takes it secretly, does him honor in this respect, that he does it secretly; but he who robs publicly and openly, together with the loss adds also the shame.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:198
verses.text: Let us therefore, both poor and rich, cease from taking the property of others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:199
verses.text: For my present discourse is not only to the rich, but to the poor also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:200
verses.text: For they too rob those who are poorer than themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:201
verses.text: And artisans who are better off, and more powerful, outsell the poorer and more distressed, tradesmen outsell tradesmen, and so all who are engaged in the market-place.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:202
verses.text: So that I wish from every side to take away injustice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:203
verses.text: For the injury consists not in the measure of the things plundered and stolen, but in the purpose of him that steals.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:204
verses.text: And that these are more thieves and defrauders, who do not despise little gains, I know and remember that I have before told you, if you also remember it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:205
verses.text: But let us not be over exact.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:206
verses.text: Let them be equally bad with the rich.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:207
verses.text: Let us instruct our mind not to covet greater things, not to aim at more than we have.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:208
verses.text: And in heavenly things let our desire of more never be satiated, but let each be ever coveting more.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 11:209
verses.text: But upon earth let every one be for what is needful and sufficient, and seek nothing more, that so he may be able to obtain the real goods, by the grace and lovingkindness of our Lord Jesus Christ, with whom to the Father, together with the Holy Spirit, be glory, strength, honor, now and always, and world without end, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:1
verses.text: Homily XI.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:2
verses.text: Thessalonians v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:3
verses.text: –  "Quench not the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:4
verses.text: Despise not prophesyings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:5
verses.text: But prove all things; hold fast that which is good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:6
verses.text: Abstain from every form of evil".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:7
verses.text: A thick mist, a darkness and cloud is spread over all the earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:8
verses.text: And, showing this, the Apostle said, "For we were once darkness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:9
verses.text: (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:10
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:11
verses.text: ) And again, "Ye, brethren, are not in darkness, that that day should overtake you as a thief".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:12
verses.text: Since therefore there is, so to speak, a moonless night, and we walk in that night, God hath given us a bright lamp, having kindled in our souls the grace of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:13
verses.text: But some who have received this light have rendered it more bright and shining, as, for instance, Paul and Peter, and all those Saints; while others have even extinguished it, as the five virgins, as those who have "made shipwreck concerning the faith," as the fornicator of Corinth, as the Galatians who were perverted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:14
verses.text: On this account Paul says, "Quench not the Spirit," that is, the gift of grace, for it is his custom so to call the gift of the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:15
verses.text: But this an impure life extinguishes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:16
verses.text: For as any one, who has sprinkled both water and dust upon the light of our lamp, extinguishes it, and if he does not this, but only takes out the oil—so it is also with the gift of grace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:17
verses.text: For if you have cast over it earthly things, and the cares of fluctuating matters, you have quenched the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:18
verses.text: And if you have done none of these things, but a temptation coming from some other quarter has vehemently assailed it, as some wind, and if the light be not strong, and it has not much oil, or you have not closed the opening, or have not shut the door, all is undone.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:19
verses.text: But what is the opening? As in the lamp, so is it also in us: it is the eye and the ear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:20
verses.text: Suffer not a violent blast of wickedness to fall upon these, since it would extinguish the lamp, but close them up with the fear of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:21
verses.text: The mouth is the door.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:22
verses.text: Shut it, and fasten it, that it may both give light, and repel the attack from without.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:23
verses.text: For instance, has any one insulted and reviled you? Do you shut the mouth; for if you open it, you add force to the wind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:24
verses.text: Do you not see in houses, when two doors stand directly opposite, and there is a strong wind, if you shut one, and there is no opposite draught, the wind has no power, but the greater part of its force is abated? So also now, there are two doors, thy mouth, and his who insults and affronts thee; if thou shuttest thy mouth, and dost not allow a draught on the other side, thou hast quenched the whole blast; but if thou openest it, it will not be restrained.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:25
verses.text: Let us not therefore quench it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:26
verses.text: And the flame is often liable to be extinguished even when no temptation assails it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:27
verses.text: When the oil fails, when we do not alms, the Spirit is quenched.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:28
verses.text: For it came to thee as an alms from God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:29
verses.text: Then He sees this fruit not existing in thee, and he abides not with an unmerciful soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:30
verses.text: But the Spirit being quenched, ye know what follows, as many of you as have walked on a road in a moonless night.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:31
verses.text: And if it is difficult to walk by night in a road from land to land, how is it safe in the road that leads from earth to heaven? Know ye not how many demons there are in the intervening space, how many wild beasts, how many spirits of wickedness? If indeed we have that light, they will be able to do us no hurt; but if we extinguish it, they soon take us captive, they soon rob us of everything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:32
verses.text: Since even robbers first extinguish the lamp, and so plunder us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:33
verses.text: For they indeed see in this darkness, since they do the works of darkness: but we are unaccustomed to that light.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:34
verses.text: Let us not then extinguish it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:35
verses.text: All evil doing extinguishes that light, whether reviling, or insolence, or whatever you can mention.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:36
verses.text: For as in the case of fire, everything that is foreign to its nature is destructive of it, but that kindles it which is congenial to it; whatever is dry, whatever is warm, whatever is fiery, kindles the flame of the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:37
verses.text: Let us not therefore overlay it with anything cold or damp; for these things are destructive of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:38
verses.text: But there is also another explanation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:39
verses.text: There were among them many indeed who prophesied truly, but some prophesied falsely.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:40
verses.text: This also he says in the Epistle to the Corinthians, that on this account He gave "the discernings of spirits".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:41
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:42
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:43
verses.text: ) For the devil, of his vile craft, wished through this gift of grace to subvert everything pertaining to the Church.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:44
verses.text: For since both the demon and the Spirit prophesied concerning the future, the one indeed uttering falsehood, and the other truth, and it was not possible from any quarter to receive a proof of one or the other, but each spoke without being called to account, as Jeremiah and Ezekiel had done, but when the time came they were convicted, He gave also the "discernings of spirits".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:45
verses.text: Since therefore then also among the Thessalonians many were prophesying, glancing at whom he says, "Neither by word, nor by epistle, as from us, as that the day of the Lord is now present" ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:46
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:47
verses.text: ), he says this here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:48
verses.text: That is, do not, because there are false prophets among you, on their account prohibit also these, and turn away from them; "quench" them "not," that is, "despise not prophesyings".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:49
verses.text: Seest thou that this is what he means by, "Prove all things"? Because he had said, "Despise not prophesyings," lest they should think that he opened the pulpit to all, he says, "Prove all things," that is, such as are really prophecies; "and hold fast that which is good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:50
verses.text: Abstain from every form of evil"; not from this or that, but from all; that you may by proof distinguish both the true things and the false, and abstain from the latter, and hold fast the former.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:51
verses.text: For thus both the hatred of the one will be vehement and the love of the other arises, when we do all things not carelessly, nor without examination, but with careful investigation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:52
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:53
verses.text: "And the God of peace Himself sanctify you wholly; and may your spirit and soul and body be preserved entire, without blame at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:54
verses.text: Observe the affection of the Teacher.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:55
verses.text: After the admonition he adds a prayer; not only that, but even introduces it in his letter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:56
verses.text: For we need both counsel and prayer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:57
verses.text: For this reason we also first giving you counsel, then offer prayers for you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:58
verses.text: And this the Initiated know.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:59
verses.text: But Paul indeed did this with good reason, having great confidence towards God, whereas we are confounded with shame, and have no freedom of speech.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:60
verses.text: But because we were appointed to this we do it, being unworthy even to stand in His presence, and to hold the place of the lowest disciples.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:61
verses.text: But because grace works even through the unworthy, not for our own sakes but for theirs who are about to be benefited, we contribute our parts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:62
verses.text: "Sanctify you wholly," he says, and may "your spirit and soul and body be preserved entire, without blame at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:63
verses.text: What does he here call the spirit? The gift of grace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:64
verses.text: For if we depart hence having our lamps bright, we shall enter into the bridechamber.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:65
verses.text: But if they are quenched, it will not be so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:66
verses.text: For this reason he says "your spirit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:67
verses.text: For if that remains pure, the other remains also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:68
verses.text: "And soul and body," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:69
verses.text: For neither the one nor the other then admits anything evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:70
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:71
verses.text: "Faithful is He that calleth you, who will also do it".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:72
verses.text: Observe his humility.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:73
verses.text: For, because he had prayed, Think not, he says, that this happens from my prayers, but from the purpose, with which He called you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:74
verses.text: For if He called you to salvation, and He is true, He will certainly save you, in that He wills it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:75
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:76
verses.text: "Brethren, pray for us also".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:77
verses.text: Strange! what humility is here! But he indeed said this for the sake of humility, but we, not from humility, but for the sake of great benefit, and wishing to gain some great profit from you, say, "Pray for us also".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:78
verses.text: For although you do not receive any great or wonderful benefit from us, do it nevertheless for the sake of the honor and the title itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:79
verses.text: Some one has had children, and even if they had not been benefited by him, nevertheless, because he has been their father, he perhaps sets this before them, saying, "For one day I have not been called father by thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:80
verses.text: On this account we too say, "Pray for us also".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:81
verses.text: I am not merely saying this, but really desiring your prayers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:82
verses.text: For if I have become responsible for this presidency over you all, and shall have to render an account, much more ought I to have the benefit of your prayers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:83
verses.text: On your account my responsibilities are greater, therefore the help also from you should be greater.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:84
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:85
verses.text: "Salute all the brethren with a holy kiss".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:86
verses.text: Oh! what fervor! Oh! what mad passion is here! Because being absent he could not greet them with the kiss, he greets them through others, as when we say, Kiss him for me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:87
verses.text: So also do ye yourselves retain the fire of love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:88
verses.text: For it does not admit of distances, but even through long intervening ways it extends itself, and is everywhere present.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:89
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:90
verses.text: "I adjure you by the Lord that this Epistle be read unto all the holy brethren".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:91
verses.text: And this command is rather from love, and not so much in the way of teaching; that with them also, he means, I may be conversing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:92
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:93
verses.text: "The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you, Amen".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:94
verses.text: And he does not merely command, but adjures them, and this from a fervent mind, that even though they should despise him, for the sake of the adjuration they may practice what is commanded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:95
verses.text: For men had a great dread of that appeal, but now that too is trampled under foot.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:96
verses.text: And often when a slave is scourged, and adjures by God and His Christ, and says, "So may you die a Christian," yet no one gives heed, no one regards it; but if he adjures him by his own son, immediately, though unwilling, and grinding his teeth, he gives up his anger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:97
verses.text: Again, another being dragged and led away through the middle of the market-place, in the presence both of Jews and Greeks, adjures him that leads him away with the most fearful adjurations, and no one regards it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:98
verses.text: What will not the Greeks say, when one of the faithful adjures a faithful man and a Christian, and no regard is paid to it, but we even despise him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:99
verses.text: Will you allow me to tell you a certain story which I myself have heard? For I do not say it of my own invention, but having heard it from a person worthy of credit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:100
verses.text: There was a certain maid-servant united to a wicked man, a vile run-away slave; she, when her husband having committed many faults was about to be sold by her mistress; (for the offenses were too great for pardon, and the woman was a widow, and was not able to punish him who was the plague of her house, and therefore resolved to sell him; then considering that it was an unholy thing to separate the husband from the wife, the mistress, although the girl was useful, to avoid separating her from him, made up her mind to sell her also with him;) then the girl seeing herself in these straits, came to a venerable person who was intimate with her mistress, and who also told it to me, and clasping her knees, and with a thousand lamentations, besought her to entreat her mistress in her behalf; and having wasted many words, at last she added this also, as thereby especially to persuade her, laying on her a most awful adjuration, and the adjuration was this, "So mayest thou see Christ at the Day of Judgment, as thou neglectest not my petition".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:101
verses.text: And having so said, she departed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:102
verses.text: And she who had been entreated, upon the intrusion of some worldly care, such as happens in families, forgot the matter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:103
verses.text: Then suddenly late in the afternoon, the most awful adjuration came into her mind, and she felt great compunction, and she went and with great earnestness asked, and obtained her request.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:104
verses.text: And that very night she suddenly saw the heavens opened, and Christ Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:105
verses.text: But she saw Him, as far as it was possible for a woman to see Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:106
verses.text: Because she at all regarded the adjuration, because she was afraid, she was thought worthy of this vision.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:107
verses.text: And these things I have said, that we may not despise adjurations, especially when any entreat us for things that are good, as for alms, and for works of mercy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:108
verses.text: But now poor men, who have lost their feet, sit and see thee hastening by, and when they cannot follow thee with their feet, they expect to detain thee, as with a kind of hook, by the fear of an adjuration, and stretching out their hands, they adjure thee to give them only one or two pennies.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:109
verses.text: But thou hastenest by, though adjured by thy Lord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:110
verses.text: And if he adjure thee by the eyes either of thy husband, who is gone abroad, or of thy son, or thy daughter, immediately thou yieldest, thy mind is transported, thou art warmed; but if he adjure thee by thy Lord, thou hastenest by.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:111
verses.text: And I have known many women who, hearing indeed the name of Christ, have hastened by; but being commended for their beauty by those who came to them, have been melted and softened, and have stretched out their hand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:112
verses.text: Yea thus they have reduced suffering and wretched beggars to this, even to deal in making sport! For when they do not touch their souls by uttering vehement and bitter words, they have recourse to this way by which they delight them exceedingly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:113
verses.text: And our great wickedness compels him that is in calamity or is straitened by hunger, to utter encomiums upon the beauty of those who pity him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:114
verses.text: And I wish this were all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:115
verses.text: But there is even another form worse than this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:116
verses.text: It compels the poor to be jugglers, and buffoons, and filthy jesters.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:117
verses.text: For when he fastens on his fingers cups and bowls and cans, and plays on them as cymbals, and having a pipe, whistles on it those base and amorous melodies, and sings them at the top of his voice; and then many stand round, and some give him a piece of bread, some a penny, and others something else, and they detain him long, and both men and women are delighted; what is more grievous than this? Are not these things deserving of much groaning? They are indeed trifling, and are considered trifling, but they engender great sins in our character.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:118
verses.text: For when any obscene and sweet melody is uttered, it softens the mind, and corrupts the very soul itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:119
verses.text: And the poor man indeed who calls upon God, and invokes a thousand blessings upon us, is not vouchsafed a word from you; but he who instead of these things introduces sportive sallies, is admired.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:120
verses.text: And what has now come into my mind to say to you, that I will utter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:121
verses.text: And what is this? When you are involved in poverty and sickness, if from no other quarter, at least from those who beg, who wander through the narrow streets, learn to give thanks to the Lord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:122
verses.text: For they, spending their whole life in begging, do not blaspheme, are not angry, nor impatient, but make the whole narrative of their beggary in thanksgiving, magnifying God, and calling Him merciful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:123
verses.text: He indeed that is perishing with hunger, calls Him merciful, but you who are living in plenty, if you cannot get the possessions of all, call Him cruel.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:124
verses.text: How much better is he! how will he condemn us! God has sent the poor through the world, as common teachers in our calamities, and consolation under them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:125
verses.text: Hast thou suffered anything contrary to thy wishes? yet nothing like what that poor man suffers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:126
verses.text: Thou hast lost an eye, but he both his.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:127
verses.text: Thou hast long labored under disease, but he has one that is incurable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:128
verses.text: Thou hast lost thy children, but he even the health of his own body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:129
verses.text: Thou hast suffered a great loss, but thou art not yet reduced to supplicate from others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:130
verses.text: Give thanks to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:131
verses.text: Thou seest them in the furnace of poverty, and begging indeed from all, but receiving from few.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:132
verses.text: When thou art weary of praying, and dost not receive, consider how often thou hast heard a poor man calling upon thee, and hast not listened to him, and he has not been angry nor insulted thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:133
verses.text: And yet thou indeed actest thus from cruelty; but God from mercy even declines to hear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:134
verses.text: If therefore thou, thyself from cruelty not hearing thy fellow-servant, expectest not to be found fault with, dost thou find fault with the Lord, who out of mercy does not hear His servant? Seest thou how great the inequality, how great the injustice?  Let us consider these things constantly, those who are below us, those who are under greater calamities, and so we shall be able to be thankful to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:135
verses.text: Life abounds with many such instances.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:136
verses.text: And he who is sober, and willing to attend, gains no small instruction from the houses of prayer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:137
verses.text: For on this account the poor sit before the vestibule both in the churches and in the chapels of the Martyrs, that we may receive great benefit from the spectacle of these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:138
verses.text: For consider, that when we enter into earthly palaces, we can see nothing of this kind; but men that are dignified and famous, and wealthy and intelligent, are everywhere hastening to and fro.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:139
verses.text: But into the real palaces, I mean the Church, and the oratories of the Martyrs, enter the demoniacs, the maimed, the poor, the aged, the blind, and those whose limbs are distorted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:140
verses.text: And wherefore? That thou mayest be instructed by the spectacle of these things; in the first place that if thou hast entered drawing after thee any pride from without, having looked upon these, and laid aside thy arrogance, and become contrite in heart, so thou mayest go in, and hear the things that are said; for it is not possible that he who prays with an arrogant mind should be heard.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:141
verses.text: That when thou seest an aged man, thou mayest not be elated at thy youth, for these old men were once young.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:142
verses.text: That when thou boastest highly of thy warfare, or thy kingly power, thou mayest consider that from these are sprung those who are become illustrious in kings' courts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:143
verses.text: That, when thou presumest upon thy bodily health, taking heed to these, thou mayest abate thy lofty spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:144
verses.text: For the healthy man who continually enters here will not be highminded on account of his bodily health; and the sick man will receive no slight consolation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:145
verses.text: But they do not sit here only on this account, but that they may also make thee compassionate, and thou mayest be inclined to pity; that thou mayest admire the lovingkindness of God; for if God is not ashamed of them, but has set them in His vestibules, much less be thou ashamed; that thou mayest not be highminded on account of palaces upon earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:146
verses.text: Be not ashamed, when called upon by a poor man; and if he should draw near, if he should catch thy knees, shake him not off.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:147
verses.text: For these are certain admirable dogs of the Royal Courts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:148
verses.text: For I do not call them dogs as dishonoring them—far be it—but even highly commending them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:149
verses.text: They guard the King's court.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:150
verses.text: Therefore feed them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:151
verses.text: For the honor passes on to the King.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:152
verses.text: There all is pride,—I speak of the palaces on earth—here all is humility.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:153
verses.text: You learn especially from the very vestibules that human beings are nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:154
verses.text: From the very persons who sit before them, you are taught that God delights not in riches.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:155
verses.text: For their sitting and assembling there is all but an admonition, sending forth a clear voice regarding the nature of all men, and saying that human things are nothing, that they are shadow and smoke.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:156
verses.text: If riches were a good, God would not have seated the poor before His own vestibule.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:157
verses.text: And if He admits rich people also, wonder not for He admits them not on this account, that they may continue rich, but that they may be delivered from their encumbrance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:158
verses.text: For hear what Christ says to them, "Ye cannot serve God and Mammon" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:159
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:160
verses.text: ); and again, "It is hard for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of heaven"; and again, "It is easier for a camel to go through a needle's eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of heaven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:161
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:162
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:164
verses.text: ) On this account He receives the rich, that they may hear these words, that they may long for the eternal riches, that they may covet things in heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:165
verses.text: And why dost thou wonder that He does not disdain to seat such at His vestibules? for He does not disdain to call them to His spiritual Table, and make them partakers of that Feast.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:166
verses.text: But the maimed and the lame, the old man that is clothed in rags and filth, and has catarrh, comes to partake of that Table with the young and the beautiful, and with him even who is clothed in purple, and whose head is encircled with a diadem—and is thought worthy of the spiritual Feast, and both enjoy the same benefits, and there is no difference.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:167
verses.text: Does then Christ not disdain to call them to His Table with the king (Emperor)—for both are called together—and thou perhaps disdainest even to be seen giving to the poor, or even conversing with them? Fie upon thy haughtiness and pride! See that we suffer not the same with the rich man formerly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:168
verses.text: He disdained even to look upon Lazarus, and did not allow him to share his roof or shelter, but he was without, cast away at his gate, nor was he even vouchsafed a word from him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:169
verses.text: But see how, when fallen into straits, and in want of his help, he failed to obtain it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:170
verses.text: For if we are ashamed of those of whom Christ is not ashamed, we are ashamed of Christ, being ashamed of His friends.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:171
verses.text: Let thy table be filled with the maimed and the lame.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:172
verses.text: Through them Christ comes, not through the rich.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:173
verses.text: Perhaps thou laughest at hearing this; therefore, that thou mayest not think it is my word, hear Christ Himself speaking, that thou mayest not laugh, but shudder: "When thou makest a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends nor thy brethren, nor thy kinsmen, nor rich neighbors; lest haply they also bid thee again, and a recompense be made thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:174
verses.text: But when thou makest a feast, bid the poor, the maimed, the halt, the blind; and thou shalt be blessed; because they have not wherewith to recompense thee: for thou shalt be recompensed in the Resurrection of the just".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:175
verses.text: (Luke xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:177
verses.text: ) And greater is thy glory even here, if thou lovest that.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:178
verses.text: For from the former class of guests arise envy, and malice, and slanders, and revilings, and much fear lest anything unbecoming should occur.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:179
verses.text: And thou standest like a servant before his master, if those who are invited are thy superiors, fearing their criticism and their lips.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:180
verses.text: But in the case of these there is nothing of this sort, but whatever you bring them, they receive all with pleasure; and ample is the applause, brighter the glory, higher the admiration.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:181
verses.text: All they that hear do not so much applaud the former, as the latter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:182
verses.text: But if thou disbelievest, thou who art rich, make the trial, thou who invitest generals and governors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:183
verses.text: Invite the poor, and fill thy table from them, and see if thou art not applauded by all, if thou art not loved by all, if all do not hold thee as a father.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Thessalonians 12:184
verses.text: For of those feasts there is no advantage, but for these heaven is in store, and the good things of heaven—of which may we all be partakers, by the grace and lovingkindness of our Lord Jesus Christ, with whom to the Father, together with the Holy Spirit, be glory, power, honor, now and ever, and world without end, Amen.
